English: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơđơ̆k Sôlômôn pơtao đe Isơrael kon drŏ-nglo Đawit.

English: To know wisdom and instruction, To perceive the words of understanding
Bahnar: Wă kơ băt hlôh tơdrong gơh hơgei păng tơdrong bơtho pơhrăm iŏk, wă kơ hlôh kơ nơ̆r hlôh wao.

English: To receive the instruction of wisdom, Justice, judgment, and equity
Bahnar: Wă kơ đei iŏk nơ̆r bơtho gơh hơgei, tơdrong tơpăt, tơdrong trŏ, tơdrong hơnơ̆ng lăm chăl arih.

English: To give prudence to the simple, To the young man knowledge and discretion
Bahnar: Wă ăn kơ lu bơngai kơtul kơwao gơh kơchăng, bơngai hơmuh hơmŏng băt hlôh păng băt tơchĕng.

English: A wise man will hear and increase learning, And a man of understanding will attain wise counsel
Bahnar: Bơngai gơh hơgei gô mơ̆ng păng rai hŏk pơhrăm, Bơngai hlôh wao gô đei iŏk tơdrong bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: To understand a proverb and an enigma, The words of the wise and their riddles.
Bahnar: Wă kơ hlôh tơdrong pơđơ̆k păng tơdrong pơtih, Lu nơ̆r bơngai gơh hơgei pơma, hăm nơ̆r lu sư pơpơn.

English: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, But fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Bahnar: Hli yom kơ Kră Yang jing tơm tơdrong hlôh wao. Lu bơngai kơtul areh kơ tơdrong gơh hơgei păng nơ̆r bơtho pơhrăm.

English: My son, hear the instruction of your father, And do not forsake the law of your mother
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r mĕ bơtho pơkă; păng 'nĕ hiơt kơ nơ̆r 'bă ih bơtho khan

English: For they will be a graceful ornament on your head, And chains about your neck.
Bahnar: Noh boih thoi hơgăl pơkao 'lơ̆ng kơpal kơ̆l ih, thoi rơbưn glang 'băk tơ hơko ih.

English: My son, if sinners entice you, Do not consent.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, tơdah lu bơngai yoch wă pơhlŭ ih, ih 'nĕ kơ chu hŏ.

English: If they say, “Come with us, Let us lie in wait to shed blood; Let us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư khan, bĕ năm kiơ̆ nhôn; chă răp pơlôch đe. Chop pơlôch pơrăm lu bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch.

English: Let us swallow them alive like Sheol, And whole, like those who go down to the Pit
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n gô luăn lu sư oei arih thoi dêh hơtâu, Păng luăn oei akâu hơpôm thoi đe huŏng lăm sơlŭng bơsat.

English: We shall find all kinds of precious possessions, We shall fill our houses with spoil
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n gô iŏk đĭ dôm tơmam gĭt, Tah mong 'bĕnh kơ hnam lu bơ̆n tơmam đơ̆ng chă plah tơgar

English: Cast in your lot among us, Let us all have one purse”
Bahnar: Iŏk akŭm hơbĭ hăm nhôn, lu bơ̆n gô đei minh pôm kơdŭng jên đĕch.

English: My son, do not walk in the way with them, Keep your foot from their path
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, 'nĕ kơ năm kiơ̆ lu sư ôh, Jơ̆ng ih weh bĕ, 'nĕ kơ yak kiơ̆ trong lu sư.

English: For their feet run to evil, And they make haste to shed blood.
Bahnar: Yua kơ jơ̆ng lu sư kơdâu kiơ̆ trong pơm kơnê̆, hăt hot chă pơlôch đe.

English: Surely, in vain the net is spread In the sight of any bird
Bahnar: Ưh kơ yua ôh dăng hơnhuăl 'bơ̆t anăp lu sem 'bôh, pih pang tơdrong kơđei.

English: But they lie in wait for their own blood, They lurk secretly for their own lives.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư wă chă pơlôch kơdih akâu, Păng răp wă pơrăm tơdrong arih kơdih.

English: So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain; It takes away the life of its owners.
Bahnar: Noh boih trong lu bơngai ham kơ pơm kơnê̆ wă chă sa lơi; Tơdrong plah tơgar gô hiong tơdrong arih lu bơngai bu đei iŏk tơmam noh.

English: Wisdom calls aloud outside; She raises her voice in the open squares.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei krao ôr tơ rok trong tih, Pơma re tơ lăm anih đe akŭm tih.

English: She cries out in the chief concourses, At the openings of the gates in the city She speaks her words
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei sư krao 'bơ̆t trong tơklah, sư pơma 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei tih.

English: “How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity? For scorners delight in their scorning, And fools hate knowledge.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai kơtul kơwao, Lu iĕm 'mêm kơ tơdrong kơtul kơwao dĭng dang yơ? Lu bơngai pơjăm pơjuă chơt hiôk pơjăm pơjuă dĭng dang yơ? Lu bơngai kơtul areh kơ tơdrong hơgei dĭng dang yơ?

English: Turn at my rebuke; Surely I will pour out my spirit on you; I will make my words known to you.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t Inh chrih, lu iĕm wih mơ̆ng bĕ, 'nâu, Inh wă tuh jơhngơ̆m đon Inh tơ lu iĕm; Inh gô tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm nơ̆r Inh.

English: Because I have called and you refused, I have stretched out my hand and no one regarded
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh krao, mă-lei lu iĕm sơngah, Inh yơ̆r ti, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bơngai bu wă lăng

English: Because you disdained all my counsel, And would have none of my rebuke
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu iĕm sơngah boih đĭ-đăng dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho khan, Ưh kơ chu iŏk tơdrong inh chrih hơmet

English: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your terror comes
Bahnar: Na dah lu iĕm đei tơdrong pơmat-tat, Inh gô hiĕk ăr, păng lu iĕm đei tơdrong hli tơrơ, Inh gô tơhuăi

English: When your terror comes like a storm, And your destruction comes like a whirlwind, When distress and anguish come upon you.
Bahnar: Kơplah tơdrong hli krưp truh tơ lu iĕm thoi kial hơbŭt, păng tơdrong pơmat-tat truh tơ lu iĕm thoi kial phŭt, Tơdrong jĭ jăn pơmat-tat truh tơ lu iĕm.

English: “Then they will call on me, but I will not answer; They will seek me diligently, but they will not find me.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh kơnh lu sư gô krao apinh Inh, Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ tơl tơwih; Lu sư adrin chă Inh, Mă-lei ưh kơ đei tơ'bơ̆p.

English: Because they hated knowledge And did not choose the fear of the LORD
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng lu sư areh kơ tơdrong hlôh wao, Ưh kơ wă rơih chă tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang.

English: They would have none of my counsel And despised my every rebuke.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ wă chu tơdrong inh bơtho khan, Pơhơi kơ tơdrong Inh chrih

English: Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own way, And be filled to the full with their own fancies.
Bahnar: Na lu sư gô luăn sa pŭ iŏk thoi trong lu sư kiơ̆, Păng phĭ hrăp lăm tơdrong lu sư hơlĕnh.

English: For the turning away of the simple will slay them, And the complacency of fools will destroy them
Bahnar: Lu bơngai bơlŭk lôch yua kơ lu sư kiơ̆ trong kơnê̆ đŏng đĕo. Păng tơdrong lu sư mă ưh kơ hiơ̆k gô pơrăm lu sư.

English: But whoever listens to me will dwell safely, And will be secure, without fear of evil.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai bu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ Inh gô oei hiôk-hian. Oei hơđơ̆ng ưh kơ đei hli kơ tơdrong kiơ truh.

English: My son, if you receive my words, And treasure my commands within you
Bahnar: Ơ dăm tơdah ih chu iŏk nơ̆r Inh pơma, Wei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă lăm jơhngơ̆m ih

English: So that you incline your ear to wisdom, And apply your heart to understanding
Bahnar: Tơdah đon ih mơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei, Păng jơhngơ̆m ih kiơ̆ tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: Yes, if you cry out for discernment, And lift up your voice for understanding
Bahnar: Tơpă, tơdah ih chơchă tơdrong hlôh wao, Tơdah 'bơ̆r ih krao chă tơdrong hlôh.

English: If you seek her as silver, And search for her as for hidden treasures
Bahnar: Tơdah ih chơchă sư thoi chă jên kăk, Păng chă sư thoi tơmam gĭt khăi

English: Then you will understand the fear of the LORD, And find the knowledge of God.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh ih gô băt hlôh kơ tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang; Păng 'bôh tơdrong hlôh wao Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: For the LORD gives wisdom; From His mouth come knowledge and understanding
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang ăn tơdrong gơh hơgei; Đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư lĕch tơdrong băt hlôh, hlôh wao.

English: He stores up sound wisdom for the upright; He is a shield to those who walk uprightly
Bahnar: Sư 'măn tơdrong gơh hơgei kơ bơngai tơpăt; Sư boih jing khêl pĕng kơ lu bơngai yak năm tơdrong trŏ.

English: He guards the paths of justice, And preserves the way of His saints.
Bahnar: Sư wei-lăng trong lu bơngai tơpăt, Sư bơwei trong lu bơngai hli yom kơ Sư.

English: Then you will understand righteousness and justice, Equity and every good path.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh ih gô băt hlôh tơdrong tơpăt tơdrong trŏ, Tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng, rim trong 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: When wisdom enters your heart, And knowledge is pleasant to your soul
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong gơh hơgei gô mơ̆t tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m ih, Tơdrong hlôh wao gô pơm kơ bơhngol ih hiôk chơt.

English: Discretion will preserve you; Understanding will keep you
Bahnar: Tơdrong băt hlôh gô wei-lăng ih, Tơdrong hlôh wao gô bơwei ih.

English: To deliver you from the way of evil, From the man who speaks perverse things
Bahnar: Wă dŏng ih klaih đơ̆ng trong pơm kơnê̆, Klaih đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơma hơlĕnh pơdăr

English: From those who leave the paths of uprightness To walk in the ways of darkness
Bahnar: Klaih đơ̆ng lu bơngai achăng lê̆ trong tơpăt, kiơ̆ trong măng mu.

English: Who rejoice in doing evil, And delight in the perversity of the wicked
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hiôk chơt pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, Chhôk hal kơ trong tơdrong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ hơlĕnh pơdăr

English: Whose ways are crooked, And who are devious in their paths
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kiơ̆ trong đŏng đĕo, Đei trong hơlĕnh hơleo kơnê̆ krưp.

English: To deliver you from the immoral woman, From the seductress who flatters with her words
Bahnar: Dŏng pơklaih ih đơ̆ng lu drŏ-kăn đi; Noh lu bơngai drŏ-kăn juăt kơ pơhlŭ đei nơ̆r rơngơp

English: Who forsakes the companion of her youth, And forgets the covenant of her God.
Bahnar: Bơngai achăng klo sư oei đơ̆ng hơmuh hơmŏng, Hiơt boih kơ nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư.

English: For her house leads down to death, And her paths to the dead
Bahnar: Yua kơ trong hnam sư jur tơ dêh atâu. Trong sư ba truh tơ anih bơhngol lu bơngai lôch oei.

English: None who go to her return, Nor do they regain the paths of life
Bahnar: Bơngai bu năm tơ sư ưh pă brŏk dơ̆ng, păng kư̆m ưh pă truh tơ tơdrong arih

English: So you may walk in the way of goodness, And keep to the paths of righteousness.
Bahnar: Lei na ih athei yak kiơ̆ trong lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng, Păng wei kiơ̆ trong lu bơngai tơpăt.

English: For the upright will dwell in the land, And the blameless will remain in it
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai tơpăt gô oei tơ lăm teh đak đêl pơkă, păng lu bơngai arih sa 'lơ̆ng gô oei tơ noh ling-lang.

English: But the wicked will be cut off from the earth, And the unfaithful will be uprooted from it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai kơnê̆ đe pơlôch lê̆ đơ̆ng teh đak, Păng lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr gô buch lê̆ đơ̆ng teh noh.

English: My son, do not forget my law, But let your heart keep my commands
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, 'nĕ kơ hiơt ôh tơdrong Inh bơtho khan; Răk bĕ tơdrong Inh tơtă lăm jơhngơ̆m ih.

English: For length of days and long life And peace they will add to you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong inh bơtho gô thim kơ ih arih sot, Păng đei hiôk jơnap.

English: Let not mercy and truth forsake you; Bind them around your neck, Write them on the tablet of your heart
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ lê̆ ôh tơdrong 'mêm mơnat păng tơnăp, 'Băk sư tơ hơko ih, chih răk sư tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m ih.

English: And so find favor and high esteem In the sight of God and man.
Bahnar: Ih gô đei tơdrong mơnat păng đei tơdrong ư-ang 'lơ̆ng. 'Bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng kon bơngai.

English: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding
Bahnar: Gơnang bĕ kơ Kră Yang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m, 'Nĕ kơ gơnang kơ đon hlôh wao ih

English: In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths.
Bahnar: 'Blŏk băt bĕ kơ Kră Yang lăm rim trong ih pơm, Na sư gô pơm kơ trong ih tơpăt.

English: Do not be wise in your own eyes; Fear the LORD and depart from evil.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ lăng gơh hơgei kiơ̆ kơ măt kơdih, Mă-lei hli yom bĕ kơ Kră Yang, weh bĕ đơ̆ng trong kơnê̆.

English: It will be health to your flesh, And strength to your bones.
Bahnar: Noh tơdrong ming rơka ih gô klaih, kơting ih gô rơngơp hiôk

English: Honor the LORD with your possessions, And with the firstfruits of all your increase
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ mŭk tơmam păng 'ba hơ'bo yuă blŭng-a lăm bơyan. Kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang.

English: So your barns will be filled with plenty, And your vats will overflow with new wine.
Bahnar: Lei na pơk ih gô 'bĕnh blai kơ 'ba hơ'bo, ge ih gô 'bĕnh kơ sik hơmu hle.

English: My son, do not despise the chastening of the LORD, Nor detest His correction
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, ih 'nĕ kơ klai ơh kơ tơdrong Kră Yang teh bơtho, Kŭm 'nĕ kơ ơh tơdah Sư chrih.

English: For whom the LORD loves He corrects, Just as a father the son in whom he delights.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang teh bơtho bơngai bu mă Sư 'mêm, Thoi 'bă teh bơtho kon sư 'mêm.

English: Happy is the man who finds wisdom, And the man who gains understanding
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ bơngai bu chă đei tơdrong gơh hơgei. Păng đei tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: For her proceeds are better than the profits of silver, And her gain than fine gold.
Bahnar: Gĭt sư hloh kơ hu. Yua sư kăp hloh kơ maih.

English: She is more precious than rubies, And all the things you may desire cannot compare with her.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei gĭt hloh kơ tơmo gôh, Đĭ-đăng tơmam kon bơngai hơpơi wă, ưh kơ gơh pơtŏ pơting.

English: Length of days is in her right hand, In her left hand riches and honor.
Bahnar: Lăm ti 'ma sư chĕp tơdrong arih sot; Lăm ti 'ngiĕo sư đei mơdrŏng tih păng ư-ang.

English: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.
Bahnar: Lu trong sư jơ̆ chơt hiôk, Păng đĭ-đăng trong sư đei hiôk-hian.

English: She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her, And happy are all who retain her.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei sư jing minh tơnơm 'long arih kơ bơngai bu đei rôp sư; Bơngai bu đei rôp sư kơjăp jô̆ bơngai pŭn hiôk tơpă.

English: The LORD by wisdom founded the earth; By understanding He established the heavens
Bahnar: Hăm tơdrong gơh hơgei Kră Yang pơjing teh đak; Hăm tơdrong băt hlôh Sư săp lu tăl plĕnh.

English: By His knowledge the depths were broken up, And clouds drop down the dew.
Bahnar: Hăm tơdrong hlôh wao Sư lu sơlŭng jrŭ bluh đak, Păng hơmơ̆l đei đak ngom.

English: My son, let them not depart from your eyes— Keep sound wisdom and discretion
Bahnar: Ơ dăm wei răk bĕ tơdrong gơh hơgei, păng tơdrong băt đon tơchĕng, 'Nĕ ăn măt ih weh ataih đơ̆ng tơdrong noh.

English: So they will be life to your soul And grace to your neck.
Bahnar: Sư noh boih jing tơdrong arih kơ bơhngol ih, Păng tơmam pơhrôp 'lơ̆ng 'băk tơ hơko ih.

English: Then you will walk safely in your way, And your foot will not stumble.
Bahnar: Ih gô yak hơđơ̆ng kơjăp lăm trong ih, Păng jơ̆ng ih huay kơ tơpling.

English: When you lie down, you will not be afraid; Yes, you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
Bahnar: Kơplah ih 'bĭch ưh kơ đei hli kiơ. Kơplah ih 'bĭch tep, ih gô tep hiôk-hian.

English: Do not be afraid of sudden terror, Nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli krưp kiơ ôh kơplah tơdrong kơnê̆ blư truh kơ ih, Kŭm 'nĕ kơ hli krưp mơ̆n kơplah ih 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ truh pơrăm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: For the LORD will be your confidence, And will keep your foot from being caught.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang boih anih ih gơnang, Sư gô wei-lăng jơ̆ng ih huay kơ puh 'năk.

English: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, When it is in the power of your hand to do so.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ sơngah pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ bơngai trŏ kơ pơm, Kơplah ti ih gơh pơm tơdrong noh. Tơdah ih đei boih

English: Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back, And tomorrow I will give it,” When you have it with you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ khan ôh kơ rông 'bôt ih, Brŏk bĕ dơning năm tơ âu dơ̆ng, inh gô ăn kơ ih.

English: Do not devise evil against your neighbor, For he dwells by you for safety’s sake.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơđâu chă đon wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ rông 'bôt ih, Dah sư oei hiôk hơiă hăm ih.

English: Do not strive with a man without cause, If he has done you no harm.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơjah hăm đe tơdrong kơ đei Tơdah đe ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ ih.

English: Do not envy the oppressor, And choose none of his ways
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ gar hăm bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Păng 'nĕ kơ kiơ̆ trong sư ôh.

English: For the perverse person is an abomination to the LORD, But His secret counsel is with the upright.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang areh kơ bơngai hơlĕnh; Mă-lei pơm buăl juăt hăm bơngai tơpăt.

English: The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked, But He blesses the home of the just.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Kră Yang hiap oei lăm hnam lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Mă-lei Sư bơnê ăn pŭn hiôk kơ hnam lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng.

English: Surely He scorns the scornful, But gives grace to the humble.
Bahnar: Hăm lu bơngai blei hiap Sư blei hiap lu bơngai juăt kơ blei hiap đe, Mă-lei sư ăn pŭn hiôk kơ bơngai bu băt pơyom.

English: The wise shall inherit glory, But shame shall be the legacy of fools.
Bahnar: Bơngai gơh hơgei gô đei tơdrong ư-ang; Mă-lei bơngai kơwao gô mơlâu.

English: Hear, my children, the instruction of a father, And give attention to know understanding
Bahnar: Ơ lu đe kon inh, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r bơtho khan đơ̆ng 'bă, Pơgling bĕ đon, wă kơ lu iĕm băt kơ tơdrong hlôh băt.

English: For I give you good doctrine: Do not forsake my law.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh đei ăn kơ iĕm hŏk pơhrăm 'lơ̆ng; 'Nĕ kơ hŭt tơdrong Inh bơtho.

English: When I was my father’s son, Tender and the only one in the sight of my mother
Bahnar: Kơplah Inh oei 'lơ̆p, Inh jing kon drŏ-nglo 'bă inh, Păng kon pôm mĕ inh.

English: He also taught me, and said to me: “Let your heart retain my words; Keep my commands, and live.
Bahnar: 'Bă inh đei bơtho inh: Wei răk bĕ lăm jơhngơ̆m nơ̆r inh pơma. Chu kơ nơ̆r inh tơtă, na ih gơh arih.

English: Get wisdom! Get understanding! Do not forget, nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ tơdrong gơh hơgei, chă bĕ tơdrong hlôh wao, 'Nĕ kơ hiơt, 'nĕ kơ hŭt lê̆ dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh pơma

English: Do not forsake her, and she will preserve you; Love her, and she will keep you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ achăng tơdrong gơh hơgei, na sư gô wei-lăng ih; 'Mêm bĕ kơ sư, na sư gô dŏng ih.

English: Wisdom is the principal thing; Therefore get wisdom. And in all your getting, get understanding.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei gĭt kăl hloh; lei iŏk bĕ tơdrong gơh hơgei; Yua bĕ dôm tơmam ih đei noh, na iŏk tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: Exalt her, and she will promote you; She will bring you honor, when you embrace her.
Bahnar: Lăng gĭt tơdrong gơh hơgei, na sư gô pôk atŏk ih, Kuăr krôp bĕ sư, na sư pơm kơ đe ư-ang kơ ih.

English: She will place on your head an ornament of grace; A crown of glory she will deliver to you.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei sư gô pơyơ̆l tơ kơpal kơ̆l ih gơwang pơkao tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Gô pơyơ̆l tơ kơ̆l ih môk pơtao ư-ang.

English: Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, And the years of your life will be many.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, mơ̆ng păng iŏk bĕ nơ̆r inh pơma, Na sơnăm ih arih sot đunh sơnăm

English: I have taught you in the way of wisdom; I have led you in right paths.
Bahnar: Inh ba ih rok trong gơh hơgei dui ih lăm trong tơpăt.

English: When you walk, your steps will not be hindered, And when you run, you will not stumble.
Bahnar: Kơplah ih năm, ih yak huay kơ pơgăn, Mưh ih kơdâu, ih huay kơ kơtơih pơ̆k.

English: Take firm hold of instruction, do not let go; Keep her, for she is your life.
Bahnar: Rôp kơjăp bĕ tơdrong bơtho khan, 'nĕ kơ achăng lê̆; Bơwei sư, yua kơ noh boih tơdrong arih ih.

English: Do not enter the path of the wicked, And do not walk in the way of evil.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ mơ̆t kiơ̆ ôh lăm trong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Păng 'nĕ kơ yak năm lăm trong lu bơngai pơm kư̆ kă.

English: Avoid it, do not travel on it; Turn away from it and pass on.
Bahnar: Weh bĕ đơ̆ng trong noh, 'nĕ kơ yak rok trong noh, Weh bĕ trong nai păng kư̆ yak tơpăt hloi.

English: For they do not sleep unless they have done evil; And their sleep is taken away unless they make someone fall.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư ưh tam mă pơm kơnê̆, lu sư ưh kơsŭk tep; Tơdah lu sư ưh tam mă pơm kơ đe, lu sư kral ưh kơ tep.

English: For they eat the bread of wickedness, And drink the wine of violence.
Bahnar: Lu sư sa 'bĕng tơdrong pơm kơnê̆, Huch sik hơmu tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp.

English: But the path of the just is like the shining sun, That shines ever brighter unto the perfect day.
Bahnar: Mă-lei trong lu bơngai tơpăt thoi hơdah pơchrang, Pơchrang hơdah truh tơ 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: The way of the wicked is like darkness; They do not know what makes them stumble.
Bahnar: Gah trong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ thoi măng mu; Lu sư ưh kơ băt kiơ pơm kơ lu sư pơ̆k.

English: My son, give attention to my words; Incline your ear to my sayings.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh pơma; Pơgling bĕ đon mơ̆ng bĕ dôm nơ̆r inh khan.

English: Do not let them depart from your eyes; Keep them in the midst of your heart
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu nơ̆r noh ataih đơ̆ng măt ih, Iŏk răk bĕ lăm jơhngơ̆m ih.

English: For they are life to those who find them, And health to all their flesh.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư jing tơdrong arih kơ lu bơngai bu chă đei sư, Tơdrong pơklaih jĭ jăn lăm akâu.

English: Keep your heart with all diligence, For out of it spring the issues of life.
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ ling-lang wă kơ wei-lăng jơhngơ̆m ih, Yua kơ tơdrong arih tơm lĕch đơ̆ng noh.

English: Put away from you a deceitful mouth, And put perverse lips far from you.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r ih 'nĕ pă pơma hơlĕnh, Weh ataih bĕ đơ̆ng hơkŭng pơma kư̆ kă.

English: Let your eyes look straight ahead, And your eyelids look right before you.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ măt lăng tơpăt anăp, 'Nĕ kơ pơ'ngeh muh tơjruh măt.

English: Ponder the path of your feet, And let all your ways be established.
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ trong ih yak mă dơhnă, Lei na trong ih yak kơjăp.

English: Do not turn to the right or the left; Remove your foot from evil.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ weh-woh 'ma 'ngiĕo, Jơ̆ng ih weh bĕ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: My son, pay attention to my wisdom; Lend your ear to my understanding
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, mơ̆ng mă nhen kơ tơdrong gơh hơgei Inh, Pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ tơdrong hlôh wao Inh

English: That you may preserve discretion, And your lips may keep knowledge.
Bahnar: Wă kơ ih răk đon gơh hơgei, bơwei 'bơ̆r hlôh wao ih.

English: For the lips of an immoral woman drip honey, And her mouth is smoother than oil
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai drŏ-kăn đi tơlĕch nơ̆r đak sut 'ngam, Păng nơ̆r sư pơma rơbơ̆r hloh kơ đak rơmă.

English: But in the end she is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a two-edged sword.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tuch-luch jing đak tăng hloh kơmăt. Han hloh kơ đao gưm 'bar pah măt

English: Her feet go down to death, Her steps lay hold of hell.
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng sư jur truh tơ tơdrong lôch Yak nơnăm sư kiơ̆ trong pơlei lôch.

English: Lest you ponder her path of life— Her ways are unstable; You do not know them.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ chă trong tơhnă wă năm tơ tơdrong arih. Wih kiơ̆ trong răm, mă-lei sư ưh kơ băt.

English: Therefore hear me now, my children, And do not depart from the words of my mouth.
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ lu đe dăm mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh; 'Nĕ kơ weh ôh đơ̆ng nơ̆r 'bơ̆r Inh pơma.

English: Remove your way far from her, And do not go near the door of her house
Bahnar: Athei weh ataih bĕ đơ̆ng trong sư; 'Nĕ kơ dơ̆ng jê̆ 'măng hnam sư.

English: Lest you give your honor to others, And your years to the cruel one
Bahnar: Hli kơnh lu iĕm ăn tơdrong pran kơtang ư-ang iĕm kơ lu bơngai nai. Păng khei sơnăm iĕm arih ăn kơ lu bơngai pơjăm pơjuă đe.

English: Lest aliens be filled with your wealth, And your labors go to the house of a foreigner
Bahnar: Hli kơnh lu bơngai tơmoi gô iŏk yua mŭk tơmam ih, Mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng ih jang mơ̆t tơ hnam pơm kơ đe mơdrŏng.

English: And you mourn at last, When your flesh and your body are consumed
Bahnar: Hli kơ đơ̆ng rŏng kơnh ih gô krao ôr, Mưh akâu jăn sĕch akar ih jô hŏnh.

English: And say: “How I have hated instruction, And my heart despised correction!
Bahnar: Ih khan, Inh areh dêh kơ tơdrong bơtho hơmet. Păng jơhngơ̆m inh sơngah kơ tơdrong chrih.

English: I have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, Nor inclined my ear to those who instructed me!
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ chu bơih nơ̆r lu 'bok bơtho khan; Inh kư̆m kuă kơ pơgling đon mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r đe bơtho khan kơ inh.

English: I was on the verge of total ruin, In the midst of the assembly and congregation.”
Bahnar: Inh wă jê̆ hiong răm boih Đơ̆ng lăm tơpôl kon pơlei inh.

English: Drink water from your own cistern, And running water from your own well.
Bahnar: Nhă bĕ đak đơ̆ng kơthŭnga ih mong. Păng nhă đak ro đơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng ih kơdih.

English: Should your fountains be dispersed abroad, Streams of water in the streets?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ tu đakb ih gô blai ro tơ trong, Lu hơbong glung ih gô ro lăm pơlei tih.

English: Let them be only your own, And not for strangers with you.
Bahnar: Đakc noh yua bĕ minh drô̆ ih, 'nĕ kơ yua hăm lu bơngai tơmoi nai.

English: Let your fountain be blessed, And rejoice with the wife of your youth.
Bahnar: Hơpơi kơ tu đak ih 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Hiôk chơt bĕ hăm akăn ih iŏk oei đơ̆ng 'lơ̆p.

English: As a loving deer and a graceful doe, Let her breasts satisfy you at all times; And always be enraptured with her love.
Bahnar: Thoi juei adruh kluh hưch kơ juei dăm. Toh sư pơhiôk ih ling-lang. Ih rai hưch wă kơ sư ling-lang măng năr.

English: For why should you, my son, be enraptured by an immoral woman, And be embraced in the arms of a seductress?
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, yua kơ kiơ ih hưch kơ drŏ-kăn đi? Liơ ih hrăn kuăr akăn đe?

English: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, And He ponders all his paths.
Bahnar: Yua kơ trong kon bơngai yak hơdah 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; Sư lăng đĭ trong lu sư yak.

English: His own iniquities entrap the wicked man, And he is caught in the cords of his sin.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô 'leh hơđong đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch sư kơdih. Tơdrong yoch sư kơdih gô chô̆ sư.

English: He shall die for lack of instruction, And in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
Bahnar: Sư gô lôch yua kơ ưh kơ mơ̆ng đei bơtho khan, Sư gô wơ̆l jrok yua kơ ưh kơhlôh kơwao.

English: My son, if you become surety for your friend, If you have shaken hands in pledge for a stranger
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, tơdah ih đei pơma tơguăt băl boih hăm rông 'bôt ih, tơdah ih đei pơkă pơkăm hăm bơngai tơmoi.

English: You are snared by the words of your mouth; You are taken by the words of your mouth.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih puh boih kơ nơ̆r pơkăm, glăi đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ih pơma.

English: So do this, my son, and deliver yourself; For you have come into the hand of your friend: Go and humble yourself; Plead with your friend.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, yua kơ ih huŏng boih lăm ti lu rông 'bôt ih, Pơm bĕ thoi âu, wă pơklaih ih kơdih. Athei năm kŭp kơ̆l apinh mơnat đơ̆ng rông 'bôt ih.

English: Give no sleep to your eyes, Nor slumber to your eyelids.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ măt ih tep, Kŭm 'nĕ ăn gơnur măt ih tep.

English: Deliver yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, And like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Bahnar: Pơklaih bĕ ih kơdih thoi kơtŏng klaih đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai lua. Thoi sem klaih đơ̆ng hơđong đe hơ'năk.

English: Go to the ant, you sluggard! Consider her ways and be wise
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai hơlah, năm lăng bĕ kơtu hmôch; Lăng mă nhen păng hŏk iŏk wă kơ hlôh wao.

English: Which, having no captain, Overseer or ruler
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ đei yŏng pơgơ̆r ôh. Kŭm ưh kơ đei bu wei-lăng wơh păng bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: Provides her supplies in the summer, And gathers her food in the harvest.
Bahnar: Na sư kư̆m băt chă mong lê̆ tơmam sa lăm bơyan phang. Păng chă pơdŭ 'măn lê̆ tơmam sa kơplah bơyan yuă kĕch.

English: How long will you slumber, O sluggard? When will you rise from your sleep?
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai hơlah, ih oei 'bĭch tep dĭng dang yơ? Dang yơ ih iung đơ̆ng tep?

English: A little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep
Bahnar: Tep tŏ sĕt; tep măt pơdơh 'biơ̆, kuăr ti 'bĭch tep tŏ sĕt.

English: So shall your poverty come on you like a prowler, And your need like an armed man.
Bahnar: Thoi noh tơdrong dơnuh gô truh tơ ih thoi bơngai plah tơgar iŏk, Tơdrong kơ'bah gô truh tơ ih, thoi bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah

English: A worthless person, a wicked man, Walks with a perverse mouth
Bahnar: Bơngai bu arih hăm 'bơ̆r kơnê̆, Lu bơngai răm, lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: He winks with his eyes, He shuffles his feet, He points with his fingers
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m jơ̆ng wă tơbăt sư lăng măt cheng wă tơ'bôh, Iŏk hơnglâu tơhlâu pơm tơdra

English: Perversity is in his heart, He devises evil continually, He sows discord.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ chă đon wă pơm kơnê̆, Ling-lang chă tơdrong tơhil.

English: Therefore his calamity shall come suddenly; Suddenly he shall be broken without remedy.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong pơmat-tat truh kơ sư ưh kơ tam băt. Sư kơdrăt răm hloi, pă gơh klaih dơ̆ng.

English: These six things the LORD hates, Yes, seven are an abomination to Him
Bahnar: Đei tơdrâu tơdrong mă Kră Yang areh, Tơpơh tơdrong Kră Yang lăng krưp dêh.

English: A proud look, A lying tongue, Hands that shed innocent blood
Bahnar: Măt lăng pơang, Hơpiĕt hơlĕnh pơdăr; Ti 'bet pơlôch bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch

English: A heart that devises wicked plans, Feet that are swift in running to evil
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m chă đon 'maih pơm kơnê̆, Jơ̆ng hăt hot kơdâu năm tơ tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: A false witness who speaks lies, And one who sows discord among brethren.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh pơma plêl, Bơngai chă tơdrong tơhil tơduă 'nhŏng oh.

English: My son, keep your father’s command, And do not forsake the law of your mother.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, wei răk bĕ nơ̆r mĕ ih pơkă, 'nĕ hiơt nơ̆r 'bă ih bơtho.

English: Bind them continually upon your heart; Tie them around your neck.
Bahnar: Wei răk lăm jơhngơ̆m ih ling-lang, 'Băk sư tơ hơko ih.

English: When you roam, they will lead you; When you sleep, they will keep you; And when you awake, they will speak with you.
Bahnar: Mưh ih yak, sư gô ba ih; Kơplah ih tep, sư gô wei-lăng ih; 'Blep ih hơđơ̆r sư pơma dơnuh.

English: For the commandment is a lamp, And the law a light; Reproofs of instruction are the way of life
Bahnar: Yua kơ nơ̆r tơtă thoi ŭnh kơđeng; Tơdrong bơtho tơ'bôh thoi hơdah, Păng tơdrong chrih wă bơtho pơhrăm noh trong tơdrong arih.

English: To keep you from the evil woman, From the flattering tongue of a seductress.
Bahnar: Wă găn ih đơ̆ng drŏ-kăn kư̆ kă; Wă kơ ih klaih đơ̆ng nơ̆r rơngơp drŏ-kăn đi pơhlŭ.

English: Do not lust after her beauty in your heart, Nor let her allure you with her eyelids.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ hưch kơ akâu sư 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ, Phŏ kơnh măt ih pơ̆k huŏng kơ tơdrong sư pơhlŭ.

English: For by means of a harlot A man is reduced to a crust of bread; And an adulteress will prey upon his precious life.
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn di tơjur ih dang minh tơpei 'bĕng mi. Akăn đe pơhlŭ pơm hơđong kơ bơhngol ih.

English: Can a man take fire to his bosom, And his clothes not be burned?
Bahnar: Hăm đei drŏ-nglo ayơ dan ŭnh 'bơ̆t kơtơh, na khan ŭnh huay kơ sa ao sư?

English: Can one walk on hot coals, And his feet not be seared?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bơngai bu yak juă kơpal ŭnh, Na khan jơ̆ng sư huay kơ pơtŏk?

English: So is he who goes in to his neighbor’s wife; Whoever touches her shall not be innocent.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă ngôi pơyô hăm akăn đe sư kư̆m thoi noh; Bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm kơ drŏ-kăn noh ưh kơ klaih ôh kơ phak.

English: People do not despise a thief If he steals to satisfy himself when he is starving.
Bahnar: Đe ưh kơ hil ôh kơ bơngai tơtông, Tơdah sư tơtông wă kơ sa năr sư pơngot

English: Yet when he is found, he must restore sevenfold; He may have to give up all the substance of his house.
Bahnar: Dah đe đei rôp sư athei duh tơpơh wơ̆t hloh; Sư gô ăn đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam sư đei đơ̆ng lăm hnam.

English: Whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding; He who does so destroys his own soul.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm pơyô kư̆ kă bơngai noh hiong đĭ tơdrong tơchĕng. Bơngai bu pơm thoi noh, gô pơrăm sư kơdih.

English: Wounds and dishonor he will get, And his reproach will not be wiped away.
Bahnar: Sư gô đei jĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m păng mơlâu, tơdrong mơlâu sư ưh kơ gơh sŭt lê̆ ôh.

English: For jealousy is a husband’s fury; Therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
Bahnar: Yua kơ gar noh tơdrong mă bơngai drŏ-nglo hil blĕk dêh, Sư ưh pă gơh mơnat boih năr sư pơm tơwih.

English: He will accept no recompense, Nor will he be appeased though you give many gifts.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ wă iŏk ôh tơmam duh dôm yơ, Mă khan duh lung ăn kơ sư mŭk tơmam lơ.

English: My son, keep my words, And treasure my commands within you.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm wei răk bĕ nơ̆r Inh, wei răk lăm jơhngơ̆m ih nơ̆r Inh tơtă.

English: Keep my commands and live, And my law as the apple of your eye.
Bahnar: Pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă, lei na ih gô arih. Păng wei nơ̆r Inh bơtho khan thoi ih wei-lăng kon-ngai lăm măt ih.

English: Bind them on your fingers; Write them on the tablet of your heart.
Bahnar: Chô̆ sư tơ hơnglâu ti ih, chih sư tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m ih.

English: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,” And call understanding your nearest kin
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ tơdrong gơh hơgei: “Ih jing mai oh Inh!” Păng krao tơdrong hlôh wao jing adrĕch adrung ih

English: That they may keep you from the immoral woman, From the seductress who flatters with her words.
Bahnar: Wă kơ sư wei ih huay kơ hlŭ kơ drŏ-kăn đi, Drŏ-kăn đi ngăl pơhlŭ hơgei đei nơ̆r 'ngam.

English: For at the window of my house I looked through my lattice
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng 'măng-'mŏk Inh lăng păng tơmang 'bôh.

English: And saw among the simple, I perceived among the youths, A young man devoid of understanding
Bahnar: Đei bơngai kơhlôh kơwao lăm lu bơngai 'nao iung tơdăm, Lăm lu tơdăm mơlôh đei minh 'nu ưh kơ hlôh băt.

English: Passing along the street near her corner; And he took the path to her house
Bahnar: Sư năm rok trong drong weh tơ hnam drŏ-kăn đi. Sư yak tơklă wă mơ̆t tơ hnam drŏ-kăn đi.

English: In the twilight, in the evening, In the black and dark night.
Bahnar: Kơplah huơ huĭnh drơ̆m kơsơ̆, kiơ̆ kơ măng mu găm, măng klăm gueo.

English: And there a woman met him, With the attire of a harlot, and a crafty heart.
Bahnar: Lăng to, minh 'nu adruh năm tơ'bơ̆p sư, Hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'nao pơguăng thoi drŏ-kăn đi jơhngơ̆m hơlĕnh bơkuĕch.

English: She was loud and rebellious, Her feet would not stay at home.
Bahnar: Pơma 'bơ̆r re lơlial, pơm 'blal ưh kơ băt mơlâu. Jơ̆ng hrăn chă huang pă đei oei hnam.

English: At times she was outside, at times in the open square, Lurking at every corner.
Bahnar: Phŏ tơ rok trong phŏ tơ kơchơ hơwơ chă kiơ̆ mum trong kueng.

English: So she caught him and kissed him; With an impudent face she said to him
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn noh rôp kuăr sư boih păng chŭm sư. 'Bơ̆r pơma kư̆ kă, wă pơhlŭ bơngai tơdăm noh khan

English: “I have peace offerings with me; Today I have paid my vows.
Bahnar: Inh đei tơmam soi pơyơ̆r bơnê tơ hnam inh, Năr 'nâu inh pơyơ̆r pơkeh boih kơ nơ̆r đêl pơkă.

English: So I came out to meet you, Diligently to seek your face, And I have found you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh wă năm sơng ih wă chă ih, na inh tơ'bơ̆p ih boih.

English: I have spread my bed with tapestry, Colored coverings of Egyptian linen.
Bahnar: Inh lơ̆k boih kơpal giơng khăn che brông 'lơ̆ng. Đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: I have perfumed my bed With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Bahnar: Iŏk 'long pơgang 'bâu phu lu 'long hol, pik lê̆ sư kơpal giơng inh 'bĭch.

English: Come, let us take our fill of love until morning; Let us delight ourselves with love.
Bahnar: Năm ngôi bĕ mă hrăp lăp thoi jơhngơ̆m hưch wă dĭng truh pơgê. Hơnul pơhiôk hăm tơdrong hưch wă.

English: For my husband is not at home; He has gone on a long journey
Bahnar: Klo inh, ưh kơ đei oei hnam ôh, sư năm tơ ataih boih.

English: He has taken a bag of money with him, And will come home on the appointed day.”
Bahnar: Sư chĕp ba kơdŭng jên boih, rŏ lăng sư brŏk truh khei pơnil kơnh.

English: With her enticing speech she caused him to yield, With her flattering lips she seduced him.
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn pơhlŭ pơlung hăm nơ̆r 'bơ̆r pơma rơngơp hơgei, lei wă kơ drŏ-nglo puh huŏng.

English: Immediately he went after her, as an ox goes to the slaughter, Or as a fool to the correction of the stocks
Bahnar: Na drŏ-nglo kiơ̆ hloi, Thoi rơmo tơno năm tơ đe 'buh sa, na thoi juei 'leh hơđong

English: Till an arrow struck his liver. As a bird hastens to the snare, He did not know it would cost his life.
Bahnar: Dĭng 'brơ̆m hră 'bet hlom lăm plei nuih; Thoi sem năm puh hơnhuăl, Mă ưh kơ băt 'nâu boih wă pơrăm tơdrong arih.

English: Now therefore, listen to me, my children; Pay attention to the words of my mouth
Bahnar: Na dang ei ơ dăm, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh, Pơgling bĕ đon kơ lu nơ̆r 'bơ̆r inh khan.

English: Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways, Do not stray into her paths
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn jơhngơ̆m ih wih kiơ̆ trong drŏ-kăn noh, Păng yak kiơ̆ jrok rok trong sư.

English: For she has cast down many wounded, And all who were slain by her were strong men.
Bahnar: Pơm kơ lơ bơngai pơ̆k huŏng păng pơlôch pơrăm kư̆m lơ.

English: Her house is the way to hell, Descending to the chambers of death.
Bahnar: Hnam sư thoi trong năm tơ dêh atâu; 'nâu trong jur năm lăm dơnâu ŭnh.

English: Does not wisdom cry out, And understanding lift up her voice?
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei ưh kơ oei krao? Tơdrong hlôh wao ưh kơ oei ôr hă?

English: She takes her stand on the top of the high hill, Beside the way, where the paths meet.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei hơ-oei tơ kơpal kông kơjung hloh, 'Bơ̆t trong; tơ rim trong tơklah puăn

English: She cries out by the gates, at the entry of the city, At the entrance of the doors
Bahnar: Jê̆ 'măng jang; 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng mơ̆t tơ pơlei tih, Tơ trong mơ̆t, sư krao ôr

English: “To you, O men, I call, And my voice is to the sons of men.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu kon bơngai, inh krao lu iĕm boih; Nơ̆r inh krao lu kon bơngai!

English: O you simple ones, understand prudence, And you fools, be of an understanding heart.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai kơ hlôh, hŏk pơhrăm bĕ tơdrong hlôh wao, Ơ lu bơngai kơtul, iŏk bĕ tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: Listen, for I will speak of excellent things, And from the opening of my lips will come right things
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ yua kơ Inh gô bơtho tơdrong gĭt kăl, Đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh khan tơdrong tơpăt.

English: For my mouth will speak truth; Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r inh pơma tơpăt sĭt; Hơkŭng inh areh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: All the words of my mouth are with righteousness; Nothing crooked or perverse is in them.
Bahnar: Dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh pơma tơdrong tơpăt ngăl, lăm noh hoh-hoy kơ tơdrong glăi.

English: They are all plain to him who understands, And right to those who find knowledge.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng hơdah hơdong kơ lu bơngai hlôh wao. Păng tơbăt tơpă kơ bơngai mă chă đei gơh hơgei.

English: Receive my instruction, and not silver, And knowledge rather than choice gold
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ nơ̆r Inh bơtho pơkă hloh kơ jên kăk. Răk bĕ tơdrong gơh hơgei 'nei hloh kơ maih se

English: For wisdom is better than rubies, And all the things one may desire cannot be compared with her.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hlôh wao gĭt hloh kơ jơmŏng; Kŏng pơting hloh kơ dôm mŭk ih 'maih wă.

English: “I, wisdom, dwell with prudence, And find out knowledge and discretion.
Bahnar: Inh boih tơm tơdrong gơh hơgei, oei hơdai hăm đon hlôh wao, Păng đei tơdrong băt hlôh, 'bôh nhen tơdrong lăng hơlen.

English: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil; Pride and arrogance and the evil way And the perverse mouth I hate.
Bahnar: Băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang jing areh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆, Inh areh kơ tơdrong pơrŏ, pơang tơdrong pơma kơnê̆, ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom; I am understanding, I have strength.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆r, gơh hơgei noh gah Inh. Inh đei pran kơtang.

English: By me kings reign, And rulers decree justice.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Inh na đei lu pơtao gơh pơgơ̆r, Păng lu yŏng gơh pơgơ̆r pơm tơpăt gơh băt pơkă trŏ.

English: By me princes rule, and nobles, All the judges of the earth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Inh, na đei lu yŏng gơh pơgơ̆r păng lu yŏng wei-lăng teh đak.

English: I love those who love me, And those who seek me diligently will find me.
Bahnar: Inh 'mêm kơ lu bơngai 'mêm kơ Inh. Bơngai bu adrin chă Inh gô tơ'bơ̆p Inh.

English: Riches and honor are with me, Enduring riches and righteousness.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơdrŏng, yŏng đe ư-ang Mŭk tơmam kơjăp lăm Inh.

English: My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold, And my revenue than choice silver.
Bahnar: Plei yua đơ̆ng Inh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ maih se, mă maih rơgoh, Hloh kơ hu đe 'nao hling.

English: I traverse the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of justice
Bahnar: Inh yak lăm trong tơpăt, băt oei lăm trong trŏ lăp.

English: That I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth, That I may fill their treasuries.
Bahnar: Ăn mơdrŏng kơ lu bơngai 'mêm kơ Inh, Tuh tơ'bĕnh ăn kơ pơk mong tơmam sư.

English: “The LORD possessed me at the beginning of His way, Before His works of old.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơjing Inh adrol hloh. Mă blŭng-a Sư pơjing sơ̆.

English: I have been established from everlasting, From the beginning, before there was ever an earth.
Bahnar: Inh boih đei blŭng-a ala chă kơ đĭ-đăng, Păng tơm rơh adrol hloh kơ pơjing teh đak.

English: When there were no depths I was brought forth, When there were no fountains abounding with water.
Bahnar: Kơplah tam đei đak dơsĭ, đei Inh bơih, Lu tu đak tam mă lĕch, đak tam mă lơ.

English: Before the mountains were settled, Before the hills, I was brought forth
Bahnar: Adrol kơ kông đak tam mă đei, groi kông tam mă 'bôh, đei Inh boih.

English: While as yet He had not made the earth or the fields, Or the primal dust of the world.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ Kră Yang pơjing teh mir na, adrol kơ đei 'mui teh, đei Inh boih.

English: When He prepared the heavens, I was there, When He drew a circle on the face of the deep
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang pơjing kơ plĕnh, păng gơwang kơ đak dơsĭ jrŭ, đei inh tơ noh.

English: When He established the clouds above, When He strengthened the fountains of the deep
Bahnar: Kơplah Sư pơjing kơjăp kơpal plĕnh, Păng đak lĕch tih lăm dơsĭ jrŭ

English: When He assigned to the sea its limit, So that the waters would not transgress His command, When He marked out the foundations of the earth
Bahnar: Hơgat kơ đak dơsĭ, wă kơ đak huay kơ tŏk hloh kơ Sư hơgăt, Kơplah Sư pơjing hơnă teh đak

English: Then I was beside Him as a master craftsman; And I was daily His delight, Rejoicing always before Him
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Inh oei gah cheng Sư bơ̆jang, Rim năr Inh pơhiôk Sư. Ling-lang chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Rejoicing in His inhabited world, And my delight was with the sons of men.
Bahnar: Chơt hiôk lăm teh đak Sư pơjing, Păng ling-lang chơt hiôk hơdai hăm kon bơngai.

English: “Now therefore, listen to me, my children, For blessed are those who keep my ways.
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ dăm, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh; Pŭn hiôk tơpă bơngai bu oei rok kiơ̆ trong inh.

English: Hear instruction and be wise, And do not disdain it.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r bơtho khan. Athei mă hơgei, 'nĕ kơ sơngah ôh.

English: Blessed is the man who listens to me, Watching daily at my gates, Waiting at the posts of my doors.
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk dêh bơngai bu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh; Oei lăng măng năr 'bơ̆t 'măng jang Inh, gô răp 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam Inh.

English: For whoever finds me finds life, And obtains favor from the LORD
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai bu tơ'bơ̆p Inh, chă 'bôh tơdrong arih. Păng đei iŏk tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul; All those who hate me love death.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai bu sơngah kơ Inh, gô pơrăm bơhngol sư kơdih; Bơngai bu areh kơ Inh, chă tơdrong lôch.

English: Wisdom has built her house, She has hewn out her seven pillars
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei đei boih pơjing hnam kơdih. Sư traih boih tơpơh tŏ jrăng sư.

English: She has slaughtered her meat, She has mixed her wine, She has also furnished her table.
Bahnar: 'Bet sa sem dơrong, hrâu bơlŭ hăm sik hơmu sư boih. Păng hơmet gơ'bang sŏng sa boih.

English: She has sent out her maidens, She cries out from the highest places of the city
Bahnar: Sư đei wơh boih đam drŏ-kăn sư, Sư krao ôr đơ̆ng anih kơjung hloh lăm pơlei tih

English: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” As for him who lacks understanding, she says to him
Bahnar: Bơngai bu kơ hlôh mơ̆t bĕ tơ âu, Sư khan kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ hlôh

English: “Come, eat of my bread And drink of the wine I have mixed.
Bahnar: Hiăng bĕ, năm sa tơmam inh, Păng huch sik hơmu inh hrâu boih.

English: Forsake foolishness and live, And go in the way of understanding.
Bahnar: Lê̆ bĕ tơdrong kơwao, na ih đei arih; Kiơ̆ bĕ trong tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: “He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, And he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hơmet bơtho bơngai blei hiap pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu kơdih. Bu chrih kơ bơngai kơnê̆ gô jĭ jơhngơ̆m.

English: Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; Rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ chrih bơtho bơngai juăt kơ blei hiap đe, kơnh sư hil kơ ih. Chrih bĕ kơ bơngai gơh hơgei, na sư gô 'mêm kơ ih.

English: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; Teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
Bahnar: Bơtho pơhrăm bĕ bơngai gơh hơgei, na sư gô gơh hơgei hloh. Pơhrăm bơngai tơpăt, na sư rai tơpăt hloh. Bơtho bơngai tơpăt, na sư gô rai thim hơgei.

English: “The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
Bahnar: Băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang, noh tơm tơdrong gơh hơgei; Băt hlôh kơ Kră Yang Rơgoh, noh boih tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: For by me your days will be multiplied, And years of life will be added to you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng Inh, na năr ih arih sot hloh, Lu sơnăm ih arih thim rai kơjung sot hloi.

English: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself, And if you scoff, you will bear it alone.”
Bahnar: Tơdah ih gơh hơgei, đei yua kơ ih kơdih; Tơdah ih blei hiap, sĭt ih gô pŭ hơngiap kơdih.

English: A foolish woman is clamorous; She is simple, and knows nothing.
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn kơtul kơwao ngăl pơma ôr kư̆ kă, Hơleng ưh kơ băt tơdrong kiơ.

English: For she sits at the door of her house, On a seat by the highest places of the city
Bahnar: Sư hơ-oei ngôi 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam sư, Kơpal tang-dŏ kơjung lăm pơlei

English: To call to those who pass by, Who go straight on their way
Bahnar: Wă krao lu bơngai oei yak rok trong, Lu bơngai yak tơpăt kiơ̆ trong kơdih

English: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here”; And as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him
Bahnar: Mơ̆t bĕ tơ âu bơngai kơhlôh; Sư kư̆m khan kơ bơngai kơwao thoi âu

English: “Stolen water is sweet, And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
Bahnar: Nhă đak đe tơtông 'ngam, sa tơmam ôn noh hiôk tơpă.

English: But he does not know that the dead are there, That her guests are in the depths of hell.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ băt ôh noh anih lôch nhơ̆m hmoi, Păng lu bơngai drŏ-kăn wơ̆n noh tă kơ oei lăm sơlŭng jrŭ dêh atâu.

English: The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son makes a glad father, But a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo gơh hơgei đei pơhiôk kơ 'bă sư. Mă-lei đei kon kơhlôh kơwao pơm kơ mĕ sư sơ'ngon.

English: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing, But righteousness delivers from death.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam đei đơ̆ng pơm kư̆ kă ưh kơ yua kiơ; Mă-lei đei tơdrong tơpăt gơh klaih đơ̆ng lôch.

English: The LORD will not allow the righteous soul to famish, But He casts away the desire of the wicked.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ lê̆ ôh lu bơngai tơpăt pơngot rơwĕt. Mă-lei sư sơngah tơdrong bơngai kư̆ kă wă.

English: He who has a slack hand becomes poor, But the hand of the diligent makes rich.
Bahnar: Ti lu bơngai jang alah apah jing dơnuh hin. Ti lu bơngai pơnam đei mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng.

English: He who gathers in summer is a wise son; He who sleeps in harvest is a son who causes shame.
Bahnar: Bu băt mong 'măn lê̆ lăm bơyan phang noh boih bơngai kon drŏ-nglo gơh hơgei; Mă-lei đei bơngai kon drŏ-nglo ayơ tep bơyan kĕch pŭ iŏk tơdrong mơlâu.

English: Blessings are on the head of the righteous, But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pŭn hiôk pôk dan kơpal kơ̆l lu bơngai tơpăt; Mă-lei lăm 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơnê̆ ôn tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: The memory of the righteous is blessed, But the name of the wicked will rot.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'blŏk kơ lu bơngai tơpăt noh pŭn hiôk, Mă-lei anăn lu bơngai kơnê̆ ôm hach.

English: The wise in heart will receive commands, But a prating fool will fall.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon gơh hơgei đei chu nơ̆r tơtă. Mă-lei 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơwao gô hiong tôch.

English: He who walks with integrity walks securely, But he who perverts his ways will become known.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu năm kiơ̆ trong tơpăt băt yak hiôk-hian. Mă-lei bơngai bu yak kiơ̆ trong đŏng gô pơmat.

English: He who winks with the eye causes trouble, But a prating fool will fall.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơ'mreh măt wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe, Păng hơkŭng 'bơ̆r bơngai kơhlôh 'bôh tơdrong răm.

English: The mouth of the righteous is a well of life, But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu bơngai tơpăt noh boih tơm tơdrong arih; Mă-lei 'bơ̆r lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ ôn tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Hatred stirs up strife, But love covers all sins.
Bahnar: Tơdrong areh jing tơdrong tơhil; Mă-lei đei tơdrong 'mêm mơnat 'bŭ đĭ lu tơdrong yoch.

English: Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has understanding, But a rod is for the back of him who is devoid of understanding.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh hơgei đei 'bôh lăm 'bơ̆r bơngai hlôh, mă-lei đei sơnguĕt teh rŏng lu bơngai kơwao.

English: Wise people store up knowledge, But the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gơh hơgei đei răt mong tơdrong hlôh wao lơ. Mă-lei 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơtul kơwao ba tơdrong truh răm.

English: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city; The destruction of the poor is their poverty.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam bơngai mơdrŏng jing thoi kơđông kơjăp kơ sư, Mă-lei tơdrong hiong răm kơ bơngai dơnuh hoh noh tơdrong dơnuh hin kơ lu sư.

English: The labor of the righteous leads to life, The wages of the wicked to sin.
Bahnar: Hrat gleh lu bơngai tơpăt noh ba tơdrong arih; Mă-lei lơi yua lu bơngai kơnê̆ noh tơdrong yoch.

English: He who keeps instruction is in the way of life, But he who refuses correction goes astray.
Bahnar: Bu mơ̆ng pơhrăm iŏk nơ̆r bơtho oei lăm trong tơdrong arih; Mă-lei bơngai bu sơngah kơ tơdrong chrih bơtho gô hiong.

English: Whoever hides hatred has lying lips, And whoever spreads slander is a fool.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ôn tơdrong hil areh gô lĕch nơ̆r 'bơ̆r pơma hơlĕnh. Păng bơngai bu chă roi sa jing bơngai kơtul.

English: In the multitude of words sin is not lacking, But he who restrains his lips is wise.
Bahnar: Pơma lơ, tơ yơ mă huay kơ glăi. Bơngai bu kĕ wei hơpiĕt noh bơngai hơgei.

English: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver; The heart of the wicked is worth little.
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt lu bơngai tơpăt thoi hu rơgoh, Jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh kơ yua kiơ.

English: The lips of the righteous feed many, But fools die for lack of wisdom.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r lu bơngai tơpăt rong arih lơ bơngai; Mă-lei lu bơngai kơwao lôch, yua kơ ưh kơ hlôh.

English: The blessing of the LORD makes one rich, And He adds no sorrow with it.
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk đơ̆ng Kră Yang ba ăn mơdrŏng; Sư ưh kơ đei thim tơdrong sơ'ngon ôh.

English: To do evil is like sport to a fool, But a man of understanding has wisdom.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơwao lăng tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ thoi hơnul; Mă-lei bơngai hơgei 'maih đei chơt hiôk lăm tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: The fear of the wicked will come upon him, And the desire of the righteous will be granted.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ hli hơmơt gô đei truh kơ sư tơpă. Mă-lei lu bơngai tơpăt gô đei thoi sư hơpơi wă.

English: When the whirlwind passes by, the wicked is no more, But the righteous has an everlasting foundation.
Bahnar: Tơdah hơbŭt truh, lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ ưh pă đei dơ̆ng; Mă-lei lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng hơnă jrăng oei đei ling-lang.

English: As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, So is the lazy man to those who send him.
Bahnar: Đak iŭ pơm kơ hơnĕnh hơker, thoi 'nhui pơm kơ măt hang, Lu bơngai hơlah sơngah kơ bơngai wơh sư thoi noh.

English: The fear of the LORD prolongs days, But the years of the wicked will be shortened.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang ba thim khei năr; Mă-lei khei sơnăm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô rai djăl.

English: The hope of the righteous will be gladness, But the expectation of the wicked will perish.
Bahnar: Tơdrong chang hơmĕng lu bơngai tơpăt băt đei chơt hiôk. Mă-lei tơdrong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ hơpơi ưh kơ đei.

English: The way of the LORD is strength for the upright, But destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
Bahnar: Trong Kră Yang kơđông kơjăp kơ bơngai tơpăt. Mă-lei đei tơdrong răm lăm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: The righteous will never be removed, But the wicked will not inhabit the earth.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt ưh kơ đei hli kơ kiơ; Mă-lei bơngai kơnê̆ pă gơh oei lăm teh.

English: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, But the perverse tongue will be cut out.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r bơngai tơpăt lĕch tơdrong gơh hơgei, Mă-lei đei hơpiĕt lu bơngai pơma kư̆ kă gô kăt lê̆.

English: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, But the mouth of the wicked what is perverse.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r bơngai tơpăt băt tơdrong trŏ 'lơ̆ng; Mă-lei đei nơ̆r 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơnê̆ lăp băt pơma hơlĕnh đĕch.

English: Dishonest scales are an abomination to the LORD, But a just weight is His delight.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ lăp ôh kơ 'long kŏng sa pơgâm. Mă-lei plei kŏng trŏ noh sư lăp đon.

English: When pride comes, then comes shame; But with the humble is wisdom.
Bahnar: Mưh tơdrong pơang truh, duh đei hloi tơdrong mơlâu. Mă-lei tơdrong hơgei oei ling-lang lăm bơngai iŏk đon ala.

English: The integrity of the upright will guide them, But the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpăt băt dui ba lu sư. Mă-lei tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô pơrăm lu sư.

English: Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness delivers from death.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng ưh kơ yua kiơ lăm năr hil blĕk, Mă-lei đei đon tơpăt pơklaih đơ̆ng tơdrong lôch.

English: The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright, But the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt 'lơ̆ng gô dơ̆ng tơpăt lăm trong lu sư, Mă-lei lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô pơ̆k huŏng lăm tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư.

English: The righteousness of the upright will deliver them, But the unfaithful will be caught by their lust.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpăt gô pơklaih lu sư; Mă-lei bơngai đŏng đĕo pơm kơ lu sư kơdih 'leh hơđong.

English: When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish, And the hope of the unjust perishes.
Bahnar: Mưh lu bơngai kơnê̆ lôch, tơdrong sư chang hơmĕng pă đei. Păng tơdrong lu sư chang gô hoh-hoy.

English: The righteous is delivered from trouble, And it comes to the wicked instead.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt gô đei dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat; Mă-lei gô đei tơdrong pơmat-tat truh tơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor, But through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ pơma wă pơrăm lu rông 'bôt sư, Mă-lei lu bơngai hơgei đei đon tơpăt gơh klaih.

English: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices; And when the wicked perish, there is jubilation.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu bơngai tơpăt mơdrŏng, đĭ lu pơlei tih đei chơt hiôk. Mă-lei đei bơngai kơnê̆ hiong răm, đe gô jreo chơt hiôk.

English: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted, But it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
Bahnar: Minh pơlei đei pŭn hiôk 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpăt, Mă-lei đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơnê̆ tơhuŏng lê̆ lu sư.

English: He who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor, But a man of understanding holds his peace.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ lăng păng pơjăm rông 'bôt, bơngai noh ưh kơ đei đon hlôh. Mă-lei lu bơngai gơh hơgei oei ngăn hreh.

English: A talebearer reveals secrets, But he who is of a faithful spirit conceals a matter.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ngăl juăt pơma 'bơ̆r lơ, pơdah tơdrong hlơp. Mă-lei bơngai bu đei đon tơpăt băt ôn hlơp tôm tơdrong.

English: Where there is no counsel, the people fall; But in the multitude of counselors there is safety.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bơtho tơ'bôh lu kon pơlei gô huŏng, Mă-lei tơdah đei bơngai pơđâu chă đon kon pơlei kĕ jei.

English: He who is surety for a stranger will suffer, But one who hates being surety is secure.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chu iŏk bơngai tơmoi nai, bơngai noh gô răm, Mă-lei bơngai bu areh kơ sơng iŏk noh, gô đei oei rơnŭk.

English: A gracious woman retains honor, But ruthless men retain riches.
Bahnar: Đe gô pơyom kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn ayơ đei đon mơnat. Mă-lei bơngai drŏ-nglo nuih pơm kơnê̆ lăp đei mơdrŏng đĕch.

English: The merciful man does good for his own soul, But he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.
Bahnar: Bơngai iơ̆m dim thim hiôk kơ bơhngol sư; Mă-lei lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô pơrăm sĕch akar sư.

English: The wicked man does deceptive work, But he who sows righteousness will have a sure reward.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơnê̆ sa apah đơ̆ng tơdrong hơlĕnh; Mă-lei lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng đei tơdrong apah sĭt.

English: As righteousness leads to life, So he who pursues evil pursues it to his own death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei jơhngơ̆m arih sa 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô đei arih; Mă-lei gah lu bơngai kư̆ kă chă tơdrong kơnê̆ gô lôch.

English: Those who are of a perverse heart are an abomination to the LORD, But the blameless in their ways are His delight.
Bahnar: Kră Yang areh kơ bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m kư̆ kă. Mă-lei bơngai bu đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt noh pơm kơ Sư lăp đon.

English: Though they join forces, the wicked will not go unpunished; But the posterity of the righteous will be delivered.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ ih băt, lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh kơ lê̆ jor ôh kơ phak; Mă-lei adrĕch lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô klaih.

English: As a ring of gold in a swine’s snout, So is a lovely woman who lacks discretion.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ ưh kơ wao, kư̆m thoi kong 'maih tơ'băk kơ muh nhŭng.

English: The desire of the righteous is only good, But the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt hơpơi wă tă kơ 'lơ̆ng ngăl; Mă-lei lu bơngai kơnê̆ chang gô noh đei hil mĭl.

English: There is one who scatters, yet increases more; And there is one who withholds more than is right, But it leads to poverty.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon hơmrah, gô rai mơdrŏng dêh. Bơngai bu kret pơ'met rai kơmah kơ'bah rai dêh.

English: The generous soul will be made rich, And he who waters will also be watered himself.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hơmrah gô đei tôm mah, Bơngai tơgŭm đe đei đe tơgŭm sư mơ̆n.

English: The people will curse him who withholds grain, But blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mong 'ba sa kơdih, kon pơlei blei hiap, Mă-lei bơngai bu đei tĕch 'ba gô sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk.

English: He who earnestly seeks good finds favor, But trouble will come to him who seeks evil.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chă tơdrong 'lơ̆ng gô đei tơdrong hiôk, Mă-lei bơngai bu wă chă tơdrong kơnê̆ gô đei tơdrong kơnê̆ truh.

English: He who trusts in his riches will fall, But the righteous will flourish like foliage.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơnang kơ mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng gô huŏng răm; Mă-lei đei bu tơpăt băt rai 'lơ̆ng thoi tơmơ̆ng hla hơdrih.

English: He who troubles his own house will inherit the wind, And the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơrŭng hnam dơnŏ sư gô pŭ kial 'biao ưh kơ đei kiơ. Lu bơngai kơhlôh kơwao gô jing đĭch kơ bơngai gơh hơgei đei hlôh wao.

English: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And he who wins souls is wise.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô đei nhen thoi tơnơm 'long arih, Bơngai gơh hơgei đei dŏng bơhngol đe.

English: If the righteous will be recompensed on the earth, How much more the ungodly and the sinner.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Kră Yang gô apah bơnê kơpal teh. Pơma kiơ kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơm yoch gô phak ngei.

English: Whoever loves instruction loves knowledge, But he who hates correction is stupid.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'maih chă đe teh bơtho noh thoi wă 'maih đei đon gơh hơgei. Bơngai bu areh kơ đe teh bơtho bơngai noh kơtul kơwao.

English: A good man obtains favor from the LORD, But a man of wicked intentions He will condemn.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng đei tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang, Mă-lei Sư jô̆ yoch lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: A man is not established by wickedness, But the root of the righteous cannot be moved.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai bơ̆n kơjăp ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng pơm tơdrong kơnê̆. Mă-lei bơngai tơpăt gô chăt rơh kơjăp.

English: An excellent wife is the crown of her husband, But she who causes shame is like rottenness in his bones.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn iơ̆m dim thoi môk pơtao ăn kơ klo sư. Mă-lei đei bơngai drŏ-kăn mơkoh noh thoi tơmam pơm kơ kơting bŭk.

English: The thoughts of the righteous are right, But the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơdă lu bơngai tơpăt jing trŏ. Mă-lei đei lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơđâu chă hơlĕnh.

English: The words of the wicked are, “Lie in wait for blood,” But the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơma chă răp pơlôch tuh pham. Mă-lei 'bơ̆r lu bơngai tơpăt dŏng pơklaih kon bơngai.

English: The wicked are overthrown and are no more, But the house of the righteous will stand.
Bahnar: Đe teh tơhuŏng lu bơngai kơnê̆ lu sư gô ưh pă đei. Mă-lei lu bơngai tơpăt oei kơjăp.

English: A man will be commended according to his wisdom, But he who is of a perverse heart will be despised.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơh hơgei đei đon tơpăt đe bơnê. Mă-lei bơngai bu jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ đe pơchê pơjăm.

English: Better is the one who is slighted but has a servant, Than he who honors himself but lacks bread.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m iŏk đon ala na pơm păi đei đĭch đam, Hloh kơ pơm pơrŏ pơang na tơmam sa ưh kơ đei.

English: A righteous man regards the life of his animal, But the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt băt wei sem dơrong; tơdrong bơngai kơnê̆ khan 'mêm noh lăp pơm kơnê̆.

English: He who tills his land will be satisfied with bread, But he who follows frivolity is devoid of understanding.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu choh jang mir na gô đei tơmam sa rơkah rơkai. Bơngai bu kiơ̆ chă tơdrong kơđei oei kơ'bah tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: The wicked covet the catch of evil men, But the root of the righteous yields fruit.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ ham 'maih chă tơgar đơ̆ng đe, Mă-lei bơngai tơpăt chăt rơh đei plei yua.

English: The wicked is ensnared by the transgression of his lips, But the righteous will come through trouble.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơm yoch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma, thoi 'leh hơđong, Lu bơngai tơpăt gô klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong truh.

English: A man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, And the recompense of a man’s hands will be rendered to him.
Bahnar: Đei plei 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng nơ̆r 'bơ̆r pơma, na ih đei tôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng. Na đe ăn trŏ thoi tơdrong jang đêl sư pơm.

English: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, But he who heeds counsel is wise.
Bahnar: Trong lu bơngai kơnê̆ khan tơpăt kiơ̆ kơ măt lu sư lăng. Gah bơngai hơgei đei đon băt mơ̆ng đe bơtho khan.

English: A fool’s wrath is known at once, But a prudent man covers shame.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơtul 'bôh hloi tơdrong sư hil, Mă-lei bơngai hơgei huay kơ hiơ̆k ôh mă đe pơjăm pơjuă.

English: He who speaks truth declares righteousness, But a false witness, deceit.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơma tơpăt băt pơm kơdranh trŏ, bơngai kơnê̆ băt pôm pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh.

English: There is one who speaks like the piercings of a sword, But the tongue of the wise promotes health.
Bahnar: Bơngai kư̆ kă chă pơma han thoi 'bet klĕch hăm đao. Mă-lei hơpiĕt lu bơngai hơgei đei hơmet klaih.

English: The truthful lip shall be established forever, But a lying tongue is but for a moment.
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt pơma tơdrong sĭt gô oei ling-lang, Hơpiĕt pơma hơlĕnh đei hrei 'nâu đĕch.

English: Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil, But counselors of peace have joy.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr oei lăm jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai chă đon kơnê̆. Mă-lei bu đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk wă chă pơhiôk đe.

English: No grave trouble will overtake the righteous, But the wicked shall be filled with evil.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ truh kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; Mă-lei đei tơdrong truh răm kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Lying lips are an abomination to the LORD, But those who deal truthfully are His delight.
Bahnar: Kră Yang areh kơ lu bơngai pơma hơlĕnh pơdăr; Mă-lei Sư lăp đon kơ lu bơngai pơma tơpăt.

English: A prudent man conceals knowledge, But the heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei wei ôn nơ̆r bơ̆n hlôh wao, Gah bơngai kơhlôh tơ'bôh hloi bơ̆n kơwao.

English: The hand of the diligent will rule, But the lazy man will be put to forced labor.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai alah gô pơm đam. Ti lu bơngai pơnam gô pơgơ̆r

English: Anxiety in the heart of man causes depression, But a good word makes it glad.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon kon bơngai pơm kơ sư rai trăp; Mă-lei đei nơ̆r rơngơp pơm kơ sư chơt hiôk.

English: The righteous should choose his friends carefully, For the way of the wicked leads them astray.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt băt chông ba lu buăl juăt sư; Trong lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơm lê̆ kơ buăl rai jrok.

English: The lazy man does not roast what he took in hunting, But diligence is man’s precious possession.
Bahnar: Bơngai alah ưh kơ hơmet 'nhĕm đêl sư prah; Mă-lei lu bơngai pơnam gram tơmam gĭt sư.

English: In the way of righteousness is life, And in its pathway there is no death.
Bahnar: Tơdrong arih oei 'bih tơdrong tơpăt; Lăm trong gơlong sư ưh kơ đei lôch.

English: A wise son heeds his father’s instruction, But a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
Bahnar: Kon gơh hơgei đei đon mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r 'bă bơtho khan. Mă-lei bơngai kơ chu lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng đe chrih bơtho.

English: A man shall eat well by the fruit of his mouth, But the soul of the unfaithful feeds on violence.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng sa plei 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư pơma; Mă-lei lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr gô sa plei kơnê̆ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: He who guards his mouth preserves his life, But he who opens wide his lips shall have destruction.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơh wei nơ̆r kơdih, bơngai noh gơh wei tơdrong arih sư; Bơngai bu ha 'bơ̆r kư̆ kă tă kơ răm ngăl.

English: The soul of a lazy man desires, and has nothing; But the soul of the diligent shall be made rich.
Bahnar: Bơhngol bơngai alah hơpơi wă tă kơ hoh-hoy; Bơhngol bơngai pơnam tơmam mah rơkah rơkai.

English: A righteous man hates lying, But a wicked man is loathsome and comes to shame.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt băt areh kơ nơ̆r hơlĕnh; Bơngai kơnê̆ pơm trŏ kơ mơlâu hlơ̆l lĕm.

English: Righteousness guards him whose way is blameless, But wickedness overthrows the sinner.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpăt băt wei bơngai oei sa 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Mă-lei tơdrong kơnê̆ teh pơrăm lê̆ lu bơngai pơm kư̆ kă.

English: There is one who makes himself rich, yet has nothing; And one who makes himself poor, yet has great riches.
Bahnar: Đei mơ'nah pơrŏ pơm mơdrŏng, mă-lei ưh kơ đei kiơ. Đei mơ'nah pơm dơnuh hin, mă-lei đei mŭk tơmam lơ.

English: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches, But the poor does not hear rebuke.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdrŏng gơh dŏng tơdrong arih sư; Lu bơngai dơnuh ưh kơ hli nơ̆r đe tơă.

English: The light of the righteous rejoices, But the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
Bahnar: Ŭnh kơđeng lu bơngai tơpăt pơchrang hơdah; Gah ŭnh kơđeng lu bơngai kơnê̆ păt đĭ.

English: By pride comes nothing but strife, But with the well-advised is wisdom.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơang lĕch tơdrong pơjah; Gah tơdrong hơgei oei lăm bơngai băt mơ̆ng đe bơtho khan.

English: Wealth gained by dishonesty will be diminished, But he who gathers by labor will increase.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng đơ̆ng iŏk sa pơgâm gô hiong huach. Mă-lei đei bu băt mong măi 'net 'net gô đei rai lơ.

English: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, But when the desire comes, it is a tree of life.
Bahnar: Tơdrong chang gô hiơ̆ kơ đei lei pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m jĭ; Bĭ tơdrong hơpơi đei hloi thoi tơnơm 'long tơdrong arih.

English: He who despises the word will be destroyed, But he who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
Bahnar: Bơngai sơngah tơdrong bơtho, to sư gô hiong răm; Mă-lei bơngai đei bu pơyom kơ nơ̆r tơtă gô apah bơnê.

English: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, To turn one away from the snares of death.
Bahnar: Tơdrong bơtho đơ̆ng lu bơngai hơgei 'nei boih tơm tơdrong arih. Pơm kơ đe weh ataih klaih đơ̆ng hơđong tơdrong lôch.

English: Good understanding gains favor, But the way of the unfaithful is hard.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hlôh wao tơpă mă đei mơnat; Mă-lei tơdrong lu bơngai pơm yoch gô pơmat-tat.

English: Every prudent man acts with knowledge, But a fool lays open his folly.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei đei pơm kiơ̆ đon hlôh wao; Gah lu bơngai kơhlôh tơ'bôh tơdrong kơtul sư.

English: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, But a faithful ambassador brings health.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơtruh tơdrong kơnê̆ gô tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong răm. Mă-lei bơngai pơtruh tơpăt băt ba tơdrong ming klaih jĭ.

English: Poverty and shame will come to him who disdains correction, But he who regards a rebuke will be honored.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu sơngah kơ tơdrong bơtho pơhrăm gô dơnuh hin păng mơlâu; Mă-lei bơngai bu đei đon iŏk đe chrih bơtho đe gô pơyom.

English: A desire accomplished is sweet to the soul, But it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơpơi wă chă đei lei pơm kơ bơhngol rơngơp; Gah lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă lê̆ tơdrong yoch tơnat pat tơpă kơ lu bơngai kơhlôh.

English: He who walks with wise men will be wise, But the companion of fools will be destroyed.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm buăl juăt hăm bơngai hơgei gô gơh hơgei. Mă-lei bơngai bu pơm buăl juăt hăm bơngai kơtul kơwao gô răm.

English: Evil pursues sinners, But to the righteous, good shall be repaid.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơmat-tat druh lu bơngai yoch. Mă-lei bơngai tơpăt đei apah pŭn hiôk.

English: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, But the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng mong tơmam ăn kơ lu kon sâu sư. Mă-lei bơngai kơnê̆ lê̆ tơmam sư kơ lu bơngai tơpăt.

English: Much food is in the fallow ground of the poor, And for lack of justice there is waste.
Bahnar: Mir na bơngai dơnuh hin đei plei sŏng sa mah rơkah rơkai; Bơngai bu yua kư̆ kă, mă tơhiong lê̆ đĭ-đăng.

English: He who spares his rod hates his son, But he who loves him disciplines him promptly.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ đei chĕp 'long teh bơtho kon drŏ-nglo sư noh areh kơ kon sư. Mă-lei đei bu 'mêm kơ kon athei khŏm teh bơtho sư.

English: The righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul, But the stomach of the wicked shall be in want.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt đei tơmam sŏng sa phĭ mah Mă-lei đei klak lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô pơngot.

English: The wise woman builds her house, But the foolish pulls it down with her hands.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn gơh hơgei đei pơm pơjing hnam sư. Mă-lei bơngai drŏ-kăn kơwao hrăn kuăr ti noh yuih lê̆ hnam sư.

English: He who walks in his uprightness fears the LORD, But he who is perverse in his ways despises Him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu năm lăm tơdrong tơpăt băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang; Mă-lei bơngai bu pơm kiơ̆ trong tơdrong kơnê̆ areh kơ Sư.

English: In the mouth of a fool is a rod of pride, But the lips of the wise will preserve them.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơtul pơma thoi đei 'long sơnguĕt teh kơdŭ rŏng kơdih. Hơkŭng lu bơngai hơgei wei akâu kơdih.

English: Where no oxen are, the trough is clean; But much increase comes by the strength of an ox.
Bahnar: Tơ yơ ưh kơ đei kơpô rơmo tơ ei bơng 'nhĕt kư̆m hoh, Mă-lei đei kĕch 'ba lơ đơ̆ng rơmo tơno choh.

English: A faithful witness does not lie, But a false witness will utter lies.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơdranh tơpăt ưh kơ băt pơma hơlĕnh; Mă-lei bơngai pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh 'bôh lĕch pơma pơdăr.

English: A scoffer seeks wisdom and does not find it, But knowledge is easy to him who understands.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai blei hiap chă tơdrong gơh hơgei ưh kơ đei. Mă-lei lu bơngai hơgei chă 'bônh đĕch tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: Go from the presence of a foolish man, When you do not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.
Bahnar: Weh bĕ đơ̆ng bơngai bơlŭk Ih wă ưh kơ đei hŏk iŏk đon hơgei.

English: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, But the folly of fools is deceit.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơgei lu bơngai đei đon kơchăng lăng băt nhen trong kơdih; Tơdrong bơlŭk lu bơngai kơtul pơma hơlĕnh kơ jơhngơ̆m sư kơdih.

English: Fools mock at sin, But among the upright there is favor.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơhlôh 'bôh hiĕk pơjăm tơdrong huai yoch, Mă-lei đei bơngai tơpăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat ăn.

English: The heart knows its own bitterness, And a stranger does not share its joy.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n đĕch băt jĭ kơ tơdrong yoch kơdih akâu, 'Nâu ưh kơ đei bu gơh klah asong tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ bơ̆n.

English: The house of the wicked will be overthrown, But the tent of the upright will flourish.
Bahnar: Hnam lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đe gô pơrăm, Mă-lei đei anih bơsŭn lu bơngai tơpăt rai hiôk-hian.

English: There is a way that seems right to a man, But its end is the way of death.
Bahnar: Đei minh pôm trong gơlong kon bơngai khan trŏ. Mă-lei tuch-luch đei tă ba tơ trong tơdrong lôch.

English: Even in laughter the heart may sorrow, And the end of mirth may be grief.
Bahnar: Mă khan kơplah oei hiĕk chơt, kư̆m đei lăm jơhngơ̆m ơh sơ'ngon. Păng tuch-luch tơdrong chơt hiôk noh jing tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon tih.

English: The backslider in heart will be filled with his own ways, But a good man will be satisfied from above.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m hơlĕnh gô tơ'bĕnh blĕk thoi sư pơm; Mă-lei bơngai 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng jơ̆ng ti kơdih đei apah kiơ̆ trong sư.

English: The simple believes every word, But the prudent considers well his steps.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơhlôh 'bôh kiơ̆ đĭ dôm nơ̆r pơma, Mă-lei lu bơngai hơgei oei lăng rim kơnao sư yak.

English: A wise man fears and departs from evil, But a fool rages and is self-confident.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei đei đon hli păng weh ataih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Mă-lei bơngai kơwao rai pơang kang ưh kơchăng.

English: A quick-tempered man acts foolishly, And a man of wicked intentions is hated.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'bônh kơ blĕk pơm tơdrong kơtul kơwao. Lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr đe gô areh.

English: The simple inherit folly, But the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơtul gô jing bơlŭk Bơngai hơgei gô đei môk pơtao tơdrong hlôh wao.

English: The evil will bow before the good, And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô bon 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai 'lơ̆ng, Păng lu bơngai kơnê̆ kuăr ti dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng jang bơngai tơpăt.

English: The poor man is hated even by his own neighbor, But the rich has many friends.
Bahnar: Bơngai dơnuh răm hăm rông 'bôt kư̆m areh; Mă-lei đei lu bơngai mơdrŏng đei buăl 'mêm rai lơ.

English: He who despises his neighbor sins; But he who has mercy on the poor, happy is he.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu areh kơ rông 'bôt sư noh bơngai yoch; Mă-lei pŭn hiôk dêh kơ bơngai bu băt mơnat kơ bơngai dơnuh hin.

English: Do they not go astray who devise evil? But mercy and truth belong to those who devise good.
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ lu bơngai wă chă đon pơm kơnê̆ noh gô wơ̆l jrok? Mă-lei đei bơngai pơđâu wă pơm 'lơ̆ng, đe gô mơnat păng jô̆ tơpăt.

English: In all labor there is profit, But idle chatter leads only to poverty.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang lap gơh đei yua, Mă-lei đei nơ̆r pơma đĕch dơnuh hin.

English: The crown of the wise is their riches, But the foolishness of fools is folly.
Bahnar: Môk pơtao kơ lu bơngai hơgei noh tơdrong mơdrŏng. Mă-lei tơdrong kơhlôh lu bơngai kơwao oei kơtul.

English: A true witness delivers souls, But a deceitful witness speaks lies.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơdranh tơpăt băt dŏng pơklaih bơhngol đe; Mă-lei bơngai pơma hơlĕnh 'bĕnh kơ pơdăr.

English: In the fear of the LORD there is strong confidence, And His children will have a place of refuge.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hli yom kơ Kră Yang, đei tơdrong gơnang kơjăp. Păng anih kơ'nơp kơjăp kơ lu kon sâu sư.

English: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, To turn one away from the snares of death.
Bahnar: Yom kơ Kră Yang jing tơm tơdrong arih. Wă pơm kơ sư weh đơ̆ng hơđong tơdrong lôch.

English: In a multitude of people is a king’s honor, But in the lack of people is the downfall of a prince.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei đei lơ noh jing ư-ang kơ pơtao. Bơngai kơtuei kon pơlei tŏ sĕt noh răm kơ bơngai pơgơ̆r.

English: He who is slow to wrath has great understanding, But he who is impulsive exalts folly.
Bahnar: Bu mă hiơ̆ kơ hil noh đei tơdrong hơgei tih. Mă-lei bu đei 'bônh kơ hil noh tơ'bôh tơdrong kơhlôh kơwao sư.

English: A sound heart is life to the body, But envy is rottenness to the bones.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m hiôk-hian tơkan ba tơdrong arih kơ akâu jăn. Mă-lei areh hơrĕnh pơm kơting tĕnh kơ bŭk.

English: He who oppresses the poor reproaches his Maker, But he who honors Him has mercy on the needy.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơjăm pơjuă bơngai dơnuh hoh noh pơjăm kơ Tơ'ngla pơjing sư; Bu mă 'mêm mơnat kơ bơngai dơnuh hoh noh ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.

English: The wicked is banished in his wickedness, But the righteous has a refuge in his death.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ gô răm lăm tơdrong yoch sư pơm. Mă khan oei lăm anih lôch bơngai tơpăt đei anih gơnang.

English: Wisdom rests in the heart of him who has understanding, But what is in the heart of fools is made known.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơgei oei lăm jơhngơ̆m bơngai hlôh wao; Mă-lei tơdrong hơgei ưh kơ oei lăm jơhngơ̆m bơngai kơtul.

English: Righteousness exalts a nation, But sin is a reproach to any people.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt băt tơiung dêh char. Mă-lei đei tơdrong kiơ yoch pơm kơ adrĕch adrung mơlâu.

English: The king’s favor is toward a wise servant, But his wrath is against him who causes shame.
Bahnar: Pơtao bơnê kơ đĭch đam tơpăt băt đon hlôh wao. Mă-lei đei hil mĭl kơ đĭch đam mă pơm kơ đe mơlâu.

English: A soft answer turns away wrath, But a harsh word stirs up anger.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r tơl rơngơp chhơp ngach tơdrong hil. Nơ̆r pơma arăng pơdrŭt tơdrong blĕk.

English: The tongue of the wise uses knowledge rightly, But the mouth of fools pours forth foolishness.
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt lu bơngai hơgei đei pơma hlôh wao; Mă-lei đei 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơhlôh rai 'bôh kơtul.

English: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, Keeping watch on the evil and the good.
Bahnar: Măt Kră Yang 'bôh jơ̆p-jang anih, Oei lăng lu bơngai kơnê̆ păng lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng.

English: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life, But perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt pơma rơngơp noh thoi tơm 'long arih; Mă-lei đei hơpiĕt lu bơngai kơnê̆ tuĕnh jĭ pơrăm lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: A fool despises his father’s instruction, But he who receives correction is prudent.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơtul kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r 'bă tơtă bơtho. Mă-lei bơngai hơgei oei mơ̆ng nơ̆r chrih bơtho.

English: In the house of the righteous there is much treasure, But in the revenue of the wicked is trouble.
Bahnar: Lăm hnam bơngai hơgei đei mŭk tơmam gĭt tih. Tơmam lu bơngai kư̆ kă tă kơ đei truh tơdrong răm.

English: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge, But the heart of the fool does not do so.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r bơngai hơgei rei tơdrong hlôh wao; Mă-lei jơhngơ̆m lu kơwao ưh kơ thoi noh.

English: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, But the prayer of the upright is His delight.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơm 'mê̆ krưp kơ Kră Yang; Mă-lei đei nơ̆r krao khan đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpăt Kră Yang lăp đon.

English: The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, But He loves him who follows righteousness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang areh dêh trong lu bơngai kơnê̆; Mă-lei sư 'mêm mơnat kơ bơngai bu kiơ̆ trong tơpăt.

English: Harsh discipline is for him who forsakes the way, And he who hates correction will die.
Bahnar: Phak kơtang tơpă bơngai bu kuă kơ kiơ̆ trong tơpăt; Bơngai areh kơ tơdrong teh bơtho gô lôch.

English: Hell and Destruction are before the LORD; So how much more the hearts of the sons of men.
