Bahnar: Hơlŭng jrŭ dêh atâu lăm âu Kră Yang 'bôh đĭ; Pơma kiơ lăm jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai!

English: A scoffer does not love one who corrects him, Nor will he go to the wise.
Bahnar: Bơngai kư̆ kă kuă kơ đe chrih. Sư ưh kơ wă kuă kơ năm tơ bơngai hơgei.

English: A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance, But by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m 'nă hal thar 'bôh muh măt chơt hiôk. Mă-lei đei jơhngơ̆m sơ'ngon pơm trăp kơ jơhngơ̆m đon.

English: The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge, But the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m bơngai gơh hơgei oei chă tơdrong hlôh wao. Mă-lei 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kư̆ kă chă luăn sa tơdrong bơlŭk.

English: All the days of the afflicted are evil, But he who is of a merry heart has a continual feast.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng năr lu bơngai pơmat-tat 'bôh thoi pơmat ngăl, Mă-lei đei jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk lăng thoi et sa ling-lang.

English: Better is a little with the fear of the LORD, Than great treasure with trouble.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m đei mŭk tơmam tŏ sĕt, Mă-lei đei jơhngơ̆m băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang. Hloh kơ đei mŭk tơmam lơ mă-lei đei jơhngơ̆m rŭng răng.

English: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, Than a fatted calf with hatred.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m sa săi 'nhot mă-lei oei tơ'mêm băl, Hloh kơ sa 'nhĕm rơmo bek mă-lei đei tơdrong areh băl.

English: A wrathful man stirs up strife, But he who is slow to anger allays contention.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'bônh kơ blĕk jing tơhil băl. Mă-lei bơngai bu hiơ̆ kơ blĕk, pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m hil 'bônh kơ ngach.

English: The way of the lazy man is like a hedge of thorns, But the way of the upright is a highway.
Bahnar: Trong lu bơngai hơlah lăng thoi dur jơla găn. Trong lu bơngai tơpăt măt lăng tơhnă 'lơ̆ng.

English: A wise son makes a father glad, But a foolish man despises his mother.
Bahnar: Kon gơh hơgei đei pơm kơ 'bă sư hiôk. Kon kơ chu hil areh kơ mĕ sư.

English: Folly is joy to him who is destitute of discernment, But a man of understanding walks uprightly.
Bahnar: Bơngai ưh kơ hlôh 'bôh tơdrong kơtul hiôk. Mă-lei bơngai hlôh 'bôh trong sư yak tơpăt.

English: Without counsel, plans go awry, But in the multitude of counselors they are established.
Bahnar: Tơdă ưh kơ chă đon pơđâu, tơdrong ih wă pơm gô hiong; Mă-lei tơdah đei đon lơ pơđâu chơchă tơdă wă pơm gô jing.

English: A man has joy by the answer of his mouth, And a word spoken in due season, how good it is!
Bahnar: Nơ̆r tơl trŏ pơm kơ đe hiôk chơt; Nơ̆r pơma lăp kiăp trŏ 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: The way of life winds upward for the wise, That he may turn away from hell below.
Bahnar: Trong tơdrong arih lu bơngai hơgei đei rai tŏk; Wă kơ sư gơh klaih đơ̆ng dêh atâu ala sŭng.

English: The LORD will destroy the house of the proud, But He will establish the boundary of the widow.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô teh tơhuŏng hnam lu bơngai pơang; Mă-lei sư gô bơwei hơdral teh lu drŏ-kăn adro.

English: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD, But the words of the pure are pleasant.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil areh kơ tơdrong lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă pơm; Mă-lei đei nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng rơgoh pơm kơ Sư lăp đon.

English: He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, But he who hates bribes will live.
Bahnar: Bơngai ham pơm kơ hnam dơnŏ sư chhŭr nuih, Mă-lei bơngai đei areh kơ sa pơgâm gơh arih.

English: The heart of the righteous studies how to answer, But the mouth of the wicked pours forth evil.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m bơngai tơpăt băt tơchĕng tơl liơ trŏ; Mă-lei đei nơ̆r lu bơngai kơnê̆ tơlĕch nơ̆r kơnê̆ kư̆ kă.

English: The LORD is far from the wicked, But He hears the prayer of the righteous.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ataih đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Jê̆ păng mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai tơpăt krao apinh.

English: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart, And a good report makes the bones healthy.
Bahnar: Măt 'bôh hơdah pơm kơ đe jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk. Tơdrong 'nao kơtơ̆ng hiôk dŏng pơklaih kơting.

English: The ear that hears the rebukes of life Will abide among the wise.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chu iŏk đe teh bơtho; Bơngai noh gô oei arih hơdai lu bơngai hlôh wao.

English: He who disdains instruction despises his own soul, But he who heeds rebuke gets understanding.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu sơngah kơ tơdrong teh bơtho, areh kơ bơhngol kơdih. Mă-lei bơngai bu chu mơ̆ng nơ̆r đe chrih bơtho, gơh đei hlôh wao.

English: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom, And before honor is humility.
Bahnar: Tơdrong băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang chrih bơtho bơngai noh gô jing hơgei; Đei iŏk đon ala ba adrol tơdrong đe pơyom.

English: The preparations of the heart belong to man, But the answer of the tongue is from the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdă wă pơm noh đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai, Mă-lei đei hơpiĕt tơl tơwih noh lĕch đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes, But the LORD weighs the spirits.
Bahnar: Lu trong kon bơngai khan rơgoh 'lơ̆ng noh lĕch đơ̆ng măt kơdih akâu; Mă-lei Kră Yang lăng lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Commit your works to the LORD, And your thoughts will be established.
Bahnar: Jao bĕ dôm tơdrong jang ih kơ Kră Yang; Na đĭ tơdrong ih wă chă gô đei.

English: The LORD has made all for Himself, Yes, even the wicked for the day of doom.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơjing boih dôm tơmam kiơ̆ kơ Sư wă yua. Mă lu bơngai kơnê̆ Kră Yang 'măn lê̆ boih kơ năr wă pơmat.

English: Everyone proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD; Though they join forces, none will go unpunished.
Bahnar: Bu đei jơhngơ̆m pơang Kră Yang areh; Sĭt tơpă wă phak lu sư ưh kơ jor.

English: In mercy and truth Atonement is provided for iniquity; And by the fear of the LORD one departs from evil.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng 'mêm băt sĭt tơdrong yoch gơh klaih; Đơ̆ng hli yom kơ Kră Yang na gơh weh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: When a man’s ways please the LORD, He makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Bahnar: Dah chăl arih bơngai bu pơhiôk Kră Yang, Na Kră Yang kư̆m ăn lu ayăt oei hiôk hăm sư.

English: Better is a little with righteousness, Than vast revenues without justice.
Bahnar: Đei lơi tŏ sĕt đơ̆ng pơm tơpăt noh 'Lơ̆ng hloh đei tơmam lơi lơ đơ̆ng hơlĕnh.

English: A man’s heart plans his way, But the LORD directs his steps.
Bahnar: Đon tơchĕng bơngai chă rơih trong kơdih wă; Mă-lei Kră Yang ba trong sư.

English: Divination is on the lips of the king; His mouth must not transgress in judgment.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơtao pơma khưm khơ̆p Na sư sek tơlang huay kơ glăi.

English: Honest weights and scales are the LORD’s; All the weights in the bag are His work.
Bahnar: Plei 'long kŏng trăp trŏ hơnơ̆ng noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang. Plei kŏng trŏ hơnơ̆ng lăm 'bi noh đơ̆ng ti Sư pơm.

English: It is an abomination for kings to commit wickedness, For a throne is established by righteousness.
Bahnar: Pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆ 'brư̆ noh lu pơtao areh dêh; Tang-dŏ pơtao kơjăp noh đơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt.

English: Righteous lips are the delight of kings, And they love him who speaks what is right.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r pơma tơpăt noh pơm ăn pơtao chơt hiôk, Lu pơtao lăp đon kơ bơngai bu pơma tơpăt.

English: As messengers of death is the king’s wrath, But a wise man will appease it.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơtao hil thoi bơngai năm roi tơbăt kơ tơdrong lôch. Mă-lei đei bơngai hơgei pơm kơ tơdrong hil ngach 'bônh.

English: In the light of the king’s face is life, And his favor is like a cloud of the latter rain.
Bahnar: Muh măt pơtao praih hơdah noh ba tơdrong arih, Tơdrong sư mơnat thoi hơmơ̆l 'mi lăm bơyan phang.

English: How much better to get wisdom than gold! And to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
Bahnar: Iŏk tơdrong hơgei noh đei gĭt hloh kơ maih; 'Maih chă tơdrong hlôh wao noh kăl hloh kơ hu!

English: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil; He who keeps his way preserves his soul.
Bahnar: Trong lu bơngai tơpăt băt weh đơ̆ng yoch. Bu kơchăng lăng trong wei rong bơhngol sư kơdih.

English: Pride goes before destruction, And a haughty spirit before a fall.
Bahnar: Pơang năm adrol, hor ba tơdrong răm; Pơang pơrŏ năm adrol, pơ̆k huŏng đơ̆ng rŏng.

English: Better to be of a humble spirit with the lowly, Than to divide the spoil with the proud.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m iŏk đon ala na oei hăm bơngai dơnuh hin, 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ klah song tơmam tơtông tơgar hăm bơngai pơang.

English: He who heeds the word wisely will find good, And whoever trusts in the LORD, happy is he.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chu iŏk đe bơtho gơh đei yua; Bơngai bu gơnang kơ Kră Yang gơh đei pŭn hiôk.

English: The wise in heart will be called prudent, And sweetness of the lips increases learning.
Bahnar: Bu đei đon gơh hơgei đe jô̆ bơngai hlôh wao; Nơ̆r pơma rơngơp pơtrơp thim tơdrong hlôh băt.

English: Understanding is a wellspring of life to him who has it. But the correction of fools is folly.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơh hơgei đei tơm tơdrong arih; Mă-lei bu kơhlôh kơwao, noh boih tơdrong phak lu sư.

English: The heart of the wise teaches his mouth, And adds learning to his lips.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m bơngai gơh hơgei đei bơtho kơ 'bơ̆r sư, Păng pơthim 'bơ̆r nơ̆r pơma đe lui.

English: Pleasant words are like a honeycomb, Sweetness to the soul and health to the bones.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơma rơngơp 'ngam thoi đak sut, 'Ngam kơ bơhngol gơh klaih praih jăng kơ kơting.

English: There is a way that seems right to a man, But its end is the way of death.
Bahnar: Đei minh trong kon bơngai khan 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Mă-lei trong noh tuch-luch sư jing trong tơdrong lôch.

English: The person who labors, labors for himself, For his hungry mouth drives him on.
Bahnar: Tơdrong băt pơngot pơdrŭt sư bơ̆jang. Đơ̆ng hơlŏng hrơ-hrŏk tơ'blŏk kơ chă jang sa.

English: An ungodly man digs up evil, And it is on his lips like a burning fire.
Bahnar: Bơngai kư̆ kă chă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ kơ đe; 'Bơ̆r nơ̆r pơma thoi pla ŭnh soh chhông sa.

English: A perverse man sows strife, And a whisperer separates the best of friends.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơlĕnh ba tơdrong pơjah. Wă pơma plah tơklah tơduă bôl buăl.

English: A violent man entices his neighbor, And leads him in a way that is not good.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh kơ lê̆ pơhlŭ rông 'bôt sư, Chông sư rok trong ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng.

English: He winks his eye to devise perverse things; He purses his lips and brings about evil.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gơ'mreh măt băt wă chă hơlĕnh, Bơngai bu kăp mơ̆m pơŏm hơkŭng noh pơm kơnê̆ boih.

English: The silver-haired head is a crown of glory, If it is found in the way of righteousness.
Bahnar: Sŏk ko jing môk ư-ang, 'Bôh đơ̆ng tơdrong jang sư tơpăt na gơh đei.

English: He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty, And he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hiơ̆ kơ blĕk Pran hloh kơ bơngai nuih kơtang. Bơngai bu kĕ wei jơhngơ̆m sư, 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ bơngai mă nuih blah iŏk pơlei tih.

English: The lot is cast into the lap, But its every decision is from the LORD.
Bahnar: Đe hlang lăng iŏk đơ̆ng kơpal tơdrơi ao. Mă-lei dôm tơdrong trŏ dah glăi tă lĕch đơ̆ng Kră Yang ngăl.

English: Better is a dry morsel with quietness, Than a house full of feasting with strife.
Bahnar: Sa minh pôm 'bĕng mi kro tơhiôk băl, 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đei 'nhĕm soi sa 'bĕnh kơ hnam mă-lei đei tơdrong tơhil băl.

English: A wise servant will rule over a son who causes shame, And will share an inheritance among the brothers.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu đĭch gơh hơgei gô pơm yŏng kơ kon drŏ-nglo bơngai mă pơm kơ đe mơlâu. Bơngai 'nâu gơh iŏk mŭk tơmam thoi 'nhŏng oh sư.

English: The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold, But the LORD tests the hearts.
Bahnar: Gŏ pơtŏ rơ̆ hu, lu tơnuh ŭnh 'buh pơlong maih; Mă-lei đei Kră Yang pơlong lăng jơhngơ̆m.

English: An evildoer gives heed to false lips; A liar listens eagerly to a spiteful tongue.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Bơngai hơlĕnh hlŭ kơ nơ̆r 'bơ̆r đe pơma kơnê̆.

English: He who mocks the poor reproaches his Maker; He who is glad at calamity will not go unpunished.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơjăm bơngai dơnuh hin, noh pơjăm Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing sư; Bơngai bu chơt hiôk kơ tơdrong pơmat truh ưh kơ klaih ôh đơ̆ng phak.

English: Children’s children are the crown of old men, And the glory of children is their father.
Bahnar: Sâu se jing môk ư-ang pơtao kơ lu kră, Mĕ 'bă jing tơdrong ư-ang kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p.

English: Excellent speech is not becoming to a fool, Much less lying lips to a prince.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơma 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ lăp ôh hăm lu bơngai kơwao, Hloh kơ noh nơ̆r pơma hơlĕnh rai ưh kơ lăp kơ bơngai pơgơ̆r.

English: A present is a precious stone in the eyes of its possessor; Wherever he turns, he prospers.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam sa pơgâm thoi jơmŏng gĭt kơ bơngai bu mă yua sư. Mă sư năm gah yơ kư̆m kĕ ngăl.

English: He who covers a transgression seeks love, But he who repeats a matter separates friends.
Bahnar: Bơngai huay kơ jô̆ đe yoch chă tơdrong 'mêm. Bơngai tơ'blŏk tơdrong yoch đe gô hiong buăl juăt.

English: Rebuke is more effective for a wise man Than a hundred blows on a fool.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r chrih mơ̆t jrŭ lăm jơhngơ̆m bơngai hơgei. Đei hloh kơ minh-hrĕng wơ̆t teh lu bơngai kơwao.

English: An evil man seeks only rebellion; Therefore a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ chă tơdrong tơblah. Mă-lei đei đe wơh bơngai yŏng kơnê̆ hloh năm blah sư.

English: Let a man meet a bear robbed of her cubs, Rather than a fool in his folly.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m tơ'bơ̆p chơgơu yŏng đe tơgar iŏk kon sư. Hloh kơ tơ'bơ̆p bơngai kơwao kơplah sư hil hơwĕng.

English: Whoever rewards evil for good, Evil will not depart from his house.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm kơnê̆ tơwih kơ đe pơm 'lơ̆ng, Tơdrong truh pơmat ưh kơ weh ôh đơ̆ng hnam sư.

English: The beginning of strife is like releasing water; Therefore stop contention before a quarrel starts.
Bahnar: Pơtơm tơhil pơjah noh nhen thoi bơnơ̆ bơ̆ đak pơchah. Thoi noh na jah pơdơh tơhil adrol kơ blĕk rai dêh.

English: He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the just, Both of them alike are an abomination to the LORD.
Bahnar: Bu dŏng bơngai kơnê̆ khan bơngai tơpăt. Bu băt jâu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt khan kơnê̆, 'Bar 'nu bre noh Kră Yang areh pơđĭ.

English: Why is there in the hand of a fool the purchase price of wisdom, Since he has no heart for it?
Bahnar: Hăm yua kiơ bơngai kơwao chĕp jên hu, Sư ưh kơ 'maih răt tơdrong hơgei.

English: A friend loves at all times, And a brother is born for adversity.
Bahnar: Buăl juăt băt 'mêm băl ling-lang. Đei 'nhŏng oh noh lăp wă tơgŭm băl lăm đei tơdrong gleh.

English: A man devoid of understanding shakes hands in a pledge, And becomes surety for his friend.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơhlôh kơwao 'bônh kơ pơkă drơ̆ng, Dơ̆ng pơkă pơkăm hăm rông 'bôt sư.

English: He who loves transgression loves strife, And he who exalts his gate seeks destruction.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'maih pơjah, chơchă tơdrong glăi. Bơngai bu tơiung 'măng jang rai kơjung chă tơdrong răm 'bônh.

English: He who has a deceitful heart finds no good, And he who has a perverse tongue falls into evil.
Bahnar: Đe bu đei đon jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ ưh kơ đei pŭn hiôk ôh; Păng bu đei hơpiĕt pơma kư̆ kă gô huŏng lăm tơdrong răm.

English: He who begets a scoffer does so to his sorrow, And the father of a fool has no joy.
Bahnar: Bu đei kon kơhlôh kơwao gô ơh sơ'ngon; 'Bă mă đei kon kơtul ưh kơ đei chơt hiôk ôh.

English: A merry heart does good, like medicine, But a broken spirit dries the bones.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk thoi pơgang sĭt. Mă-lei đei jơhngơ̆m sơ'ngon pơm kơ kơting kro krĕnh.

English: A wicked man accepts a bribe behind the back To pervert the ways of justice.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ iŏk sa pơgâm. Wă pơlơ̆m tơdrong tơpăt.

English: Wisdom is in the sight of him who has understanding, But the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
Bahnar: Bơngai hlôh 'bôh tơdrong hơgei 'bơ̆t anăp sư; Mă-lei đei măt lu kơwao lăng tơ tôch teh đak.

English: A foolish son is a grief to his father, And bitterness to her who bore him.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo kơtul pơm kơ 'bă sư sơ'ngon, Kon kơwao pơm kơ mĕ mă tơpŭ kơ sư ơh.

English: Also, to punish the righteous is not good, Nor to strike princes for their uprightness.
Bahnar: Phak lu bơngai tơpăt noh glăi Kŭm thoi teh lu bơngai pơgơ̆r 'lơ̆ng.

English: He who has knowledge spares his words, And a man of understanding is of a calm spirit.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu wei nơ̆r sư pơma noh gơh hơgei; Lei bu tơchĕng kĕ ĕnh noh wă jing bơngai hlôh wao.

English: Even a fool is counted wise when he holds his peace; When he shuts his lips, he is considered perceptive.
Bahnar: Bu kĕ ngăn mă kơwao jô̆ jing hơgei; Wei pơŏm 'bơ̆r gơh kĕ jô̆ hlôh wao.

English: A man who isolates himself seeks his own desire; He rages against all wise judgment.
Bahnar: Bu arih hơdrô̆ kuă kơ hơdai bơngai noh chơchă kiơ̆ kơdih wă, Kuă kơ chu kiơ̆ tơdrong tơchĕng trŏ.

English: A fool has no delight in understanding, But in expressing his own heart.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơtul ưh kơ wă ôh tơdrong hlôh wao; Mă-lei 'maih roi tơdrong kơdih akâu tơchĕng đĕch.

English: When the wicked comes, contempt comes also; And with dishonor comes reproach.
Bahnar: Mưh đe pơm kơnê̆, đei pơjăm hloi; Mưh đei tơdrong mơlâu, kư̆m đei hlơ̆l lĕm hloi.

English: The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters; The wellspring of wisdom is a flowing brook.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng minh 'nu bơngai thoi đak jrŭ; Tu tơdrong gơh hơgei, thoi đak glung oei ro.

English: It is not good to show partiality to the wicked, Or to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ ôh mơ̆t bơngai kơnê̆; Sek pơglăi lê̆ bơngai tơpăt.

English: A fool’s lips enter into contention, And his mouth calls for blows.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r lu bơngai kơwao ba tơdrong pơjah; 'Bơ̆r pơma pơgreh chă đe teh sư kơdih.

English: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, And his lips are the snare of his soul.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r bơngai kơwao pơma pơrăm tơ'ngla kơdih; Thoi hơđong hơ'năk kơ bơhngol kơdih akâu.

English: The words of a talebearer are like tasty trifles, And they go down into the inmost body.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r đe roi hơlĕnh sơlam thoi tơmam sa 'ngam; Păng mơ̆t truh tơ klơm klak.

English: He who is slothful in his work Is a brother to him who is a great destroyer.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơlah noh; Thoi 'nhŏng oh lu bơngai pơrăm.

English: The name of the LORD is a strong tower; The righteous run to it and are safe.
Bahnar: Anăn Kră Yang jing kơđông kơjăp; Lu bơngai tơpăt băt kơdâu tơ noh đei anih kơ'nơp hơđơ̆ng.

English: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, And like a high wall in his own esteem.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam bơngai mơdrŏng, jing pơlei tih kơjăp kơdih akâu sư. Sư khan thoi dur kơjung kơjăp pĕng tăp kơ sư.

English: Before destruction the heart of a man is haughty, And before honor is humility.
Bahnar: Đei jơhngơ̆m pơang adrol kơ tơdrong răm truh; Tơdrong iŏk đon ala, ba tơdrong đe pơyom.

English: He who answers a matter before he hears it, It is folly and shame to him.
Bahnar: Bu tơl adrol kơ kơtơ̆ng. Noh mơlâu kơdih akâu kơwao tơpă.

English: The spirit of a man will sustain him in sickness, But who can bear a broken spirit?
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m hơđơ̆ng kĕ chơ̆n đơ̆ng jĭ jăn; Mă-lei tơdah đei hiong tơdrong hơmĕng liơ kĕ chơ̆n.

English: The heart of the prudent acquires knowledge, And the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m bơngai hơgei đei iŏk đon hlôh wao; Đon bơngai hơgei oei chă tơdrong băt hlôh.

English: A man’s gift makes room for him, And brings him before great men.
Bahnar: Tơmam bu pơyơ̆r gô pơih trong kơ sư. Ba sư truh tơ anăp lu bơngai yŏng mơng.

English: The first one to plead his cause seems right, Until his neighbor comes and examines him.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bơngai adrol pơma rŏ kơ trŏ; Phŏ truh đei apinh na gơh nhen.

English: Casting lots causes contentions to cease, And keeps the mighty apart.
Bahnar: Hlang lăng gơh pơtôch tơdrong pơjah. Plah 'bar pah pran huay pă pơjah.

English: A brother offended is harder to win than a strong city, And contentions are like the bars of a castle.
Bahnar: Pơlung 'nhŏng oh lăp jơhngơ̆m, kơtrơ̆m jah blah kơđông kơjăp đĕch 'bônh; Tơdrong pơjah noh nhen thoi pơlei kơjăp chơkăl 'măng jang boih.

English: A man’s stomach shall be satisfied from the fruit of his mouth; From the produce of his lips he shall be filled.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r bơ̆n pơma ba kơ klak phĭ. Đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma gô pơyua kơ bơ̆n phĭ mah.

English: Death and life are in the power of the tongue, And those who love it will eat its fruit.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng hơpiĕt gơh pơm kơ bơ̆n arih dah lôch; Bu 'mêm kơ sư gô yua sa đơ̆ng plei noh.

English: He who finds a wife finds a good thing, And obtains favor from the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chă đei akăn chă đei boih pŭn hiôk; Păng đei mơnat tih đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: The poor man uses entreaties, But the rich answers roughly.
Bahnar: Bơngai dơnuh apinh tơdrong mơnat; Lu bơngai mơdrŏng hơrăk tơnat tơl tơwih.

English: A man who has friends must himself be friendly, But there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
Bahnar: Bơngai đei buăl juăt lơ pơmat kơ sư kơdih; Mă-lei bơngai đei minh 'nu buăl tơpăt juăt hloh kơ 'nhŏng oh pôm mĕ 'bă.

English: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity Than one who is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
Bahnar: Bơngai dơnuh hin arih sa 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ bơngai bơlŭk pơma hơlĕnh.

English: Also it is not good for a soul to be without knowledge, And he sins who hastens with his feet.
Bahnar: Bơngai chơgăm ră mă-lei ưh kơ đei đon hlôh kư̆m ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Bơngai băt hăt kơ năm kư̆m pơ̆k.

English: The foolishness of a man twists his way, And his heart frets against the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơwao kư̆m gô tơhiong trong sư. Mă-lei đei jơhngơ̆m sư hil kơ Kră Yang.

English: Wealth makes many friends, But the poor is separated from his friend.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdrŏng đei kơtum kơtŏng lơ. Bơngai pơmat-tat mă đei buăl đe kư̆m achăng sư.

English: A false witness will not go unpunished, And he who speaks lies will not escape.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơdranh hơlĕnh ưh kơ gơh klĕnh ôh đơ̆ng tơdrong phak; Bơngai pơma hơlĕnh kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klĕnh klaih.

English: Many entreat the favor of the nobility, And every man is a friend to one who gives gifts.
Bahnar: Lơ bơngai chă tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng bơngai hơmrah. Păng đĭ-đăng pơm buăl juăt hăm bơngai ăn đĕch.

English: All the brothers of the poor hate him; How much more do his friends go far from him! He may pursue them with words, yet they abandon him.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng 'nhŏng oh bơngai dơnuh kư̆m areh kơ sư; Pơma kiơ lu buăl juăt đĕch kư̆m achăng lê̆ sư. Sư druh chă wă pơlung, tơ yơ pă 'bôh dơ̆ng lu sư.

English: He who gets wisdom loves his own soul; He who keeps understanding will find good.
Bahnar: Bu đei đon gơh hơgei wei akâu kơdih, Bu bơwei đon hlôh wao gô chă đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: A false witness will not go unpunished, And he who speaks lies shall perish.
Bahnar: Bu pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh ưh kơ klĕnh hlôi ôh đơ̆ng phak. Bu pơma hơlĕnh gô hiong răm.

English: Luxury is not fitting for a fool, Much less for a servant to rule over princes.
Bahnar: Oei arih sa hiôk jơnap ưh kơ lăp trŏ ôh kơ lu bơngai kơtul kơwao. Pơma kiơ khan lu đĭch đam jing yŏng kơ lu kon pơtao.

English: The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger, And his glory is to overlook a transgression.
Bahnar: Bơngai gơh hơgei đei đon huay 'bônh kơ blĕk. Păng huay kơ jô̆ yo mă đe pơm yoch kơ sư.

English: The king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion, But his favor is like dew on the grass.
Bahnar: Pơtao hil nhen thoi dăm-brang grĕnh Mă-lei đei tơdrong sư mơnat thoi ngom kơpal 'nhĕt.

English: A foolish son is the ruin of his father, And the contentions of a wife are a continual dripping.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo kơtul jing pơrăm kơ 'bă sư; Akăn hrăn tơhil tơtil nhen thoi đak 'mi hngăt lĕch ling-lang.

English: Houses and riches are an inheritance from fathers, But a prudent wife is from the LORD.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam hnam oei noh đei đơ̆ng kră pơsư̆ ăn. Akăn gơh hơgei đei đơ̆ng Kră Yang asong.

English: Laziness casts one into a deep sleep, And an idle person will suffer hunger.
Bahnar: Tơdrong alah mah pơm kơ đe tep pok. Bơngai ayơ ngôi đĕch gô pơngot.

English: He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, But he who is careless of his ways will die.
Bahnar: Bu răk tơdrong juăt, băt wei tơdrong arih kơdih; Mă-lei bu ưh kơ bơwei oei arih sa 'lơ̆ng gô lôch.

English: He who has pity on the poor lends to the LORD, And He will pay back what he has given.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu băt mơnat kơ bơngai dơnuh hoh, noh thoi ăn kơ Kră Yang mơng; Kră Yang pơkă wă tơwih ăn thoi tơdrong 'lơ̆ng sư pơm.

English: Chasten your son while there is hope, And do not set your heart on his destruction.
Bahnar: Bơtho hơmet bĕ kon iĕm kơplah oei đei hơmĕng; Mă-lei 'nĕ kơ đei đon wă pơlôch sư.

English: A man of great wrath will suffer punishment; For if you rescue him, you will have to do it again.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hil dêh gô pŭ đe phak. Tơdah ih dŏng sư, Ih athei dŏng pơklaih sư dơ̆ng.

English: Listen to counsel and receive instruction, That you may be wise in your latter days.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r bơtho athei, wei iŏk bĕ nơ̆r đe tơ'bôh; Wă kơ ih gơh hơgei đei đon hlôh wao đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp.

English: There are many plans in a man’s heart, Nevertheless the LORD’s counsel—that will stand.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai đei lơ tơdă wă pơm, Mă-lei đei tơdrong Kră Yang wă gô jing.

English: What is desired in a man is kindness, And a poor man is better than a liar.
Bahnar: Đe wă kơ 'bôh lăm bơngai noh 'noh pơm 'lơ̆ng. Mă dơnuh hin ră mă-lei 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ bơngai hơlĕnh.

English: The fear of the LORD leads to life, And he who has it will abide in satisfaction; He will not be visited with evil.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang ba tơdrong arih. Bu đei tơdrong noh hiôk-hian hloh; ưh pă đei rŭng răng.

English: A lazy man buries his hand in the bowl, And will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơlah tah ti lăm chhĕr; Mă-lei oei kuă kơ tah lăm 'bơ̆r mơ̆n.

English: Strike a scoffer, and the simple will become wary; Rebuke one who has understanding, and he will discern knowledge.
Bahnar: Teh bĕ bơngai pơm kơnê̆, lê̆ kơ bơngai kơwao hŏk iŏk băt hlôh. Bơtho hơmet bĕ bơngai băt hlôh, sư 'bôh thim tơdrong gơh hơgei.

English: He who mistreats his father and chases away his mother Is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'maih pơrăm 'bă, chă puh tơweh mĕ, Noh jơ̆ kon drŏ-nglo pơm mơlâu akâu kơdih.

English: Cease listening to instruction, my son, And you will stray from the words of knowledge.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, dah ih pơdơh pă mơ̆ng đe bơtho khan noh, Lei pơm kơ ih tơklah ataih đơ̆ng nơ̆r hlôh wao.

English: A disreputable witness scorns justice, And the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơdranh hơlĕnh pơjăm tơdrong tơpăt; 'Bơ̆r bơngai pơm kơnê̆ luăn sa nơ̆r glăi yoch.

English: Judgments are prepared for scoffers, And beatings for the backs of fools.
Bahnar: Tơdrong phak 'măn boih kơ bơngai blei hiap Chă lê̆ 'long wă teh rŏng lu bơngai bơlŭk.

English: Wine is a mocker, Strong drink is a brawler, And whoever is led astray by it is not wise.
Bahnar: Sik hơmu pơm kơ đe suai jing bơngai blei hiap. Sik hơmu et suai pơm kơ bơngai ôr tơkĕch. Bu et hloh kơ ai suai jing pă đei đon tơchĕng hơgei.

English: The wrath of a king is like the roaring of a lion; Whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own life.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơtao hil thoi dăm-brang grĕnh, Bơngai bu kơ chu pơgreh pơtao gô hiong tơdrong arih kơdih akâu.

English: It is honorable for a man to stop striving, Since any fool can start a quarrel.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu kĕ wei huay kơ tơhil băl, bơngai noh đe ư-ang; Lu bơngai kơhlôh đĕch ngăl pơjah tơhil băl.

English: The lazy man will not plow because of winter; He will beg during harvest and have nothing.
Bahnar: Lăm bơyan puih phang, lu bơngai hơlah ưh kơ jang mir 'ba; Na truh bơyan kĕch 'ba lu sư chă sa mă-lei ưh kơ đei 'bôh.

English: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water, But a man of understanding will draw it out.
Bahnar: Tơdrong chă đon lăm kon bơngai thoi đak jrŭ. Mă-lei bơngai hơgei đei đon hlôh wao gô sŏ iŏk tơ noh.

English: Most men will proclaim each his own goodness, But who can find a faithful man?
Bahnar: Lơ bơngai pơang kơdih akâu khan tơnăp. Mă-lei chă lăng hăm đei minh 'nu tơnăp?

English: The righteous man walks in his integrity; His children are blessed after him.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt băt oei arih sa 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ lu kon sâu sư!

English: A king who sits on the throne of judgment Scatters all evil with his eyes.
Bahnar: Pơtao ngôi kơpal tang-dŏ sư sek tơlang, Yua măt sư lăng đĕch 'bôh lĕch đĭ lu tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Who can say, “I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin”?
Bahnar: Bu pơ̆n khan: Inh wei-lăng jơhngơ̆m inh rơgoh, Inh rơgoh pă đei yoch boih?

English: Diverse weights and diverse measures, They are both alike, an abomination to the LORD.
Bahnar: Kŏng ưh kơ trŏ, pơtŏ ưh kơ tôm 'bar tơdrong noh Kră Yang areh dêh.

English: Even a child is known by his deeds, Whether what he does is pure and right.
Bahnar: Mă hơ'lơ̆p bơ̆n gơh 'bôh sư liơ, noh đơ̆ng sư pơm. Sư rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, dah tơpăt.

English: The hearing ear and the seeing eye, The LORD has made them both.
Bahnar: Măt wă lăng păng đon wă kơtơ̆ng, 'Bar noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơjing.

English: Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; Open your eyes, and you will be satisfied with bread.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hrăn tep, kơnh ih jing dơnuh hoh. Lar măt hơdơ̆r bĕ na ih phĭ jơnap.

English: “It is good for nothing,” cries the buyer; But when he has gone his way, then he boasts.
Bahnar: Bơngai răt băt pơjăm khan: “Kơnê̆, kơnê̆ dêh,” Mă-lei mưh răt iŏk, brŏk bơnê khan 'lơ̆ng.

English: There is gold and a multitude of rubies, But the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
Bahnar: Đei maih đei jơmŏng lơ; Mă-lei đei 'bơ̆r đon hơgei noh mă tơmam gĭt hloh.

English: Take the garment of one who is surety for a stranger, And hold it as a pledge when it is for a seductress.
Bahnar: Rôp ao wă pơkơ̆ng tơdah sư drơ̆ng wă dŏng bơngai tơmoi; Sư athei đei tơmam pơdơ̆ng, dah sư drơ̆ng wă huai iŏk bơngai drŏ-kăn tơmoi.

English: Bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man, But afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel.
Bahnar: Tơmam sa 'ngam 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng hơlĕnh, Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sa hơga 'bĕnh kơ 'bơ̆r.

English: Plans are established by counsel; By wise counsel wage war.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng bơtho tơ'bôh na chă đon gơh kơjăp. Năm tơblah athei đei đon pơgơ̆r hơgei.

English: He who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets; Therefore do not associate with one who flatters with his lips.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai yak ưh kơ tơklă wă pơdah tơdrong hlơp; Thoi ei lei 'nĕ pă pơm buăl hăm bơngai 'bơ̆r 'bơ̆t 'nguaih.

English: Whoever curses his father or his mother, His lamp will be put out in deep darkness.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hiap mĕ 'bă, Ŭnh kơđeng sư gô păt hơngăm lăm măng mu.

English: An inheritance gained hastily at the beginning Will not be blessed at the end.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam mă bơ̆n jah đei blŭng-a, ưh kơ đei yua hiôk đunh ôh.

English: Do not say, “I will recompense evil”; Wait for the LORD, and He will save you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơma khan, tơan wă pơm kơ đe kơnê̆. Lê̆ gô mơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang, na Sư gô dŏng pơklaih ih.

English: Diverse weights are an abomination to the LORD, And dishonest scales are not good.
Bahnar: Plei kŏng ưh kơ trŏ, Kră Yang areh dêh; 'long kŏng kư̆ kă Kră Yang ưh kơ lăp đon.

English: A man’s steps are of the LORD; How then can a man understand his own way?
Bahnar: Kră Yang boih ba rim kơnao yak kon bơngai; Lei liơ kon bơngai mă gơh băt trong kơdih?

English: It is a snare for a man to devote rashly something as holy, And afterward to reconsider his vows.
Bahnar: Pơm hơđong kơ bơngai bu mă pơkă wă pơyơ̆r tơmam kiơ hăt hot. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơkă na mă tơchĕng lăng.

English: A wise king sifts out the wicked, And brings the threshing wheel over them.
Bahnar: Pơtao gơh hơgei lei đei 'bôh đĭ lu bơngai kơnê̆, lê̆ jơ̆ng gre kơtĭt kơpal lu sư.

English: The spirit of a man is the lamp of the LORD, Searching all the inner depths of his heart.
Bahnar: Bơhngol lăm kon bơngai noh ŭnh kơđeng Kră Yang. Wă chă lăng păng nhơk tơ anih hlơp lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Mercy and truth preserve the king, And by lovingkindness he upholds his throne.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'mêm păng tơnăp tơpă mă gơh wei pơtao, Đơ̆ng 'mêm mơnat pơkơ̆ng kơjăp tang-dŏ pơtao sư.

English: The glory of young men is their strength, And the splendor of old men is their gray head.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ư-ang lu tơdăm noh pran kơtang lu sư, Ư-ang kơ lu kră noh sŏk ko.

English: Blows that hurt cleanse away evil, As do stripes the inner depths of the heart.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng teh rơka rơkĕch noh pơm rơgoh tơdrong kơnê̆, Tơnguĕt đe teh noh han mơ̆t truh anih hlơp lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: The king’s heart is in the hand of the LORD, Like the rivers of water; He turns it wherever He wishes.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m pơtao lăm ti Kră Yang thoi đak glung ro; Sư ăn ro tơ yơ mơ̆ng kơ Sư wă.

English: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, But the LORD weighs the hearts.
Bahnar: Trong kon bơngai wă tă tơpăt kiơ̆ kơ măt sư kơdih. Mă-lei đei Kră Yang lăng lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: To do righteousness and justice Is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
Bahnar: Pơm tơdrong tơpăt, băt pơm tơdrong trŏ Noh Kră Yang lăp đon hloh kơ tơmam soi pơyơ̆r.

English: A haughty look, a proud heart, And the plowing of the wicked are sin.
Bahnar: Măt lăng pơrŏ, păng jơhngơ̆m pơang, Ŭnh kơđeng lu bơngai kơnê̆, tă kơ yoch ngăl.

English: The plans of the diligent lead surely to plenty, But those of everyone who is hasty, surely to poverty.
Bahnar: Tơdă lu bơngai hiă pơnam đei tơmam rơkah rơkai. Mă-lei đei lu bơngai pơm hăt hot gô jing pơngot dơnuh.

English: Getting treasures by a lying tongue Is the fleeting fantasy of those who seek death.
Bahnar: Đei tơmam yua đơ̆ng pơma hơlĕnh tĕnh kơ hiong thoi hơyuh đak Kơ lu bơngai chơchă tơdrong lôch.

English: The violence of the wicked will destroy them, Because they refuse to do justice.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ dui ba lu sư răm. Yua kơ lu sư sơngah pơm tơdrong tơpăt.

English: The way of a guilty man is perverse; But as for the pure, his work is right.
Bahnar: Trong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đŏng đĕo; Mă-lei tơdrong jang bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh noh oei tơpăt ling-lang.

English: Better to dwell in a corner of a housetop, Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m oei 'bơ̆t chaih jih bơbŭng hnam 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ oei hơdai akăn mơkoh.

English: The soul of the wicked desires evil; His neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ hơpơi wă chă tơdrong kơnê̆. Lu kon pơlei oei jê̆ sư ưh kơ đei layơ hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp sư.

English: When the scoffer is punished, the simple is made wise; But when the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
Bahnar: Kơplah đe phak lu bơngai blei hiap. Bơngai kơtul gô hơgei, Kơplah bơtho lu bơngai hơgei, sư đei iŏk đon hlôh wao.

English: The righteous God wisely considers the house of the wicked, Overthrowing the wicked for their wickedness.
Bahnar: Yŏng 'lơ̆ng tơpăt băt lăng hơlen hnam bơngai pơm kơnê̆; Yŏng noh hơloh tơlơ̆ lê̆ lu bơngai kơnê̆ lăm tơdrong pơmat.

English: Whoever shuts his ears to the cry of the poor Will also cry himself and not be heard.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chĭt đon kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai dơnuh hin krao ôr, Bơngai noh đe kư̆m kuă kơ mơ̆ng drơ̆ng nơ̆r sư krao ôr mơ̆n.

English: A gift in secret pacifies anger, And a bribe behind the back, strong wrath.
Bahnar: Tơmam ăn hlơp pơm rơngơp tơdrong hil. Tơmam sa pơgâm mơ̆t lăm jơhngơ̆m blĕk rai ngach.

English: It is a joy for the just to do justice, But destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
Bahnar: Pơm tơdrong tơpăt noh băt pơhiôk, lu bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng, Mă-lei đei tơdrong hli kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: A man who wanders from the way of understanding Will rest in the assembly of the dead.
Bahnar: Bơngai wơ̆l hiong tơdrong gơh hơgei Gô oei hơdai hăm khŭl bơngai lôch.

English: He who loves pleasure will be a poor man; He who loves wine and oil will not be rich.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ham kơ hiôk chơt gô dơnuh. Bơngai bu puh lăm sik hơmu păng đak rơmă plei ôliwơ ưh kơ layơ mơdrŏng.

English: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, And the unfaithful for the upright.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơnê̆ tơmam 'măn lê̆ wă huai iŏk bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Bơngai hơlĕnh gô huai tơplih anih lu bơngai tơpăt.

English: Better to dwell in the wilderness, Than with a contentious and angry woman.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m oei hơdrô̆ lăm char glă. 'Lơ̆ng hloh oei hơdai bơngai drŏ-kăn hrăn tơhil jŏk.

English: There is desirable treasure, And oil in the dwelling of the wise, But a foolish man squanders it.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơgei đei 'măn tơmam gĭt păng rơmă plei ôliwơ; Bơngai kơtul kơwao sa đĭ tơmam sư đei.

English: He who follows righteousness and mercy Finds life, righteousness, and honor.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chă tơdrong tơpăt păng băt 'mêm Gô đei tơdrong arih tơpăt păng đe ư-ang.

English: A wise man scales the city of the mighty, And brings down the trusted stronghold.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei tŏk blah pơlei tih lu bơngai nuih kơtang. Pơrăm lê̆ đĭ anih kơjăp mă lu sư gơnang.

English: Whoever guards his mouth and tongue Keeps his soul from troubles.
Bahnar: Bu gơh wei 'bơ̆r hơpiĕt, Gơh wei bơhngol klaih đơ̆ng pơmat-tat.

English: A proud and haughty man— “Scoffer” is his name; He acts with arrogant pride.
Bahnar: Blei hiap, noh anăn lu bơngai pơang pơrŏ; Sư pơm kư̆ kă chă pôk pơang dêh.

English: The desire of the lazy man kills him, For his hands refuse to labor.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơpơi wă lu bơngai alah Gô pơlôch sư kơdih yua kơ ti sư kuă kơ jang.

English: He covets greedily all day long, But the righteous gives and does not spare.
Bahnar: Rim năr bơngai ham hrăn hơpơi kơ tơmam. Mă-lei đei lu bơngai tơpăt băt asong huay kơ 'mêm ôh.

English: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; How much more when he brings it with wicked intent!
Bahnar: Tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ Kră Yang areh dêh, pơma kiơ tơdah lu sư pơyơ̆r hăm jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ tăm.

English: A false witness shall perish, But the man who hears him will speak endlessly.
Bahnar: Bu pơma hơlĕnh gô lôch răm, Mă-lei đei bơngai bu chu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ sư gơh pơma ling-lang.

English: A wicked man hardens his face, But as for the upright, he establishes his way.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ pơm lê̆ muh măt arăng kơchu. Lu bơngai tơpăt băt pơm kơ trong sư kơjăp.

English: There is no wisdom or understanding Or counsel against the LORD.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei tơdrong gơh hơgei ayơ, tơdrong đon hlôh wao ayơ, Dah tơdrong chă đon kơnê̆ ayơ, Mă gơh blah Kră Yang.

English: The horse is prepared for the day of battle, But deliverance is of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đe chă aseh wă 'măn kơ năr năm tơblah; Mă-lei kĕ jei noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: A good name is to be chosen rather than great riches, Loving favor rather than silver and gold.
Bahnar: Anăn đe pơư jơ̆p-jang noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ mơdrŏng. Đe pơyom noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đei hu maih.

English: The rich and the poor have this in common, The LORD is the maker of them all.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdrŏng bơngai dơnuh kư̆m lei-lăi. Bre sư đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơjing ngăl.

English: A prudent man foresees evil and hides himself, But the simple pass on and are punished.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei 'bôh đei tơdrong truh kơdâu weh. Bơngai kơwao kư̆ yak truh puh hloi lăm noh.

English: By humility and the fear of the LORD Are riches and honor and life.
Bahnar: Tơdrong apah kơ bơngai iŏk đon ala, păng hli yom kơ Kră Yang. Noh tơdrong mơdrŏng, tơdrong arih păng đe pơyom.

English: Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse; He who guards his soul will be far from them.
Bahnar: Jơla păng hơ'năk hơđong kơ trong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Bu wei bơhngol sư weh ataih đơ̆ng trong noh.

English: Train up a child in the way he should go, And when he is old he will not depart from it.
Bahnar: Bơtho tơ'bôh bĕ kơ lu bơngai oei hơ'lơ̆p trong sư wă yak kiơ̆. Wă truh tơ kră lu sư huay kơ weh dơ̆ng trong noh.

English: The rich rules over the poor, And the borrower is servant to the lender.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdrŏng jing yŏng lu bơngai dơnuh, Bơngai bu tŏk iŏk jing đĭch kơ bơngai ăn iŏk.

English: He who sows iniquity will reap sorrow, And the rod of his anger will fail.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu rei đŏng gô tŏng kơ sư tơdrong pơmat; 'Long băl sư hil gô tơgơ̆.

English: He who has a generous eye will be blessed, For he gives of his bread to the poor.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei măt lăng mơnat sư gô đei pŭn hiôk. Yua kơ sư đei tơgŭm tơmam sa kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin.

English: Cast out the scoffer, and contention will leave; Yes, strife and reproach will cease.
Bahnar: Pơpuh bĕ bơngai juăt pơgreh na tơdrong pơjah weh kiơ̆ sư; Tơdrong pơjah pơjăng păng mơlâu akâu 'nâu gô đĭ.

English: He who loves purity of heart And has grace on his lips, The king will be his friend.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu chă wă 'mêm kơ jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng rơgoh noh pơma nơ̆r băt mơnat. Gô pơm buăl juăt hăm pơtao.

English: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, But He overthrows the words of the faithless.
Bahnar: Măt Kră Yang wei-lăng lu bơngai hơgei; Mă-lei sư tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơma.

English: The lazy man says, “There is a lion outside! I shall be slain in the streets!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơlah khan đei dăm-brang tơ 'nguaih to. Inh gô lôch tơ rok trong.

English: The mouth of an immoral woman is a deep pit; He who is abhorred by the LORD will fall there.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'bơ̆r bơngai akăn đe pơm đi thoi sơlŭng jrŭ tơpă. Bơngai mă Kră Yang hil dêh gô huŏng tơ lăm noh.

English: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; The rod of correction will drive it far from him.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơtul kơhlôh 'bôh oei chô̆ jơhngơ̆m lu hơ'lơ̆p. Mă-lei đei yua 'long teh bơtho tơdrong kơtul lĕch tơ ataih kơ sư.

English: He who oppresses the poor to increase his riches, And he who gives to the rich, will surely come to poverty.
Bahnar: Bu pơđep bơngai dơnuh wă pơm kơ sư mơdrŏng, Bơngai bu ăn pơgâm kơ lu bơngai mơdrŏng noh rai pơm kơ bre sư dơnuh hloh.

English: Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise, And apply your heart to my knowledge
Bahnar: Pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ lu bơngai hơgei pơma, Na gô pơih jơhngơ̆m ih đih sơng tơdrong hơgei inh.

English: For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you; Let them all be fixed upon your lips
Bahnar: Ih gô chơt hiôk tơdah ih răk sư lăm jơhngơ̆m, Păng wei sư oei lăm 'bơ̆r hơkŭng ih ling-lang.

English: So that your trust may be in the LORD; I have instructed you today, even you.
Bahnar: Inh bơtho tơ'bôh boih kơ ih năr 'nâu; Wă kơ ih đei đon lui gơnang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Have I not written to you excellent things Of counsels and knowledge
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Inh đei chih kơ ih boih pêng-jĭt tơdrong 'lơ̆ng. Pơma bơtho athei đe lăm tơdrong hlôh wao?

English: That I may make you know the certainty of the words of truth, That you may answer words of truth To those who send to you?
Bahnar: Bơtho kơ ih nơ̆r trŏ, păng sĭt Wă kơ ih gơh tơl tơwih nơ̆r bơngai wơh ih?

English: Do not rob the poor because he is poor, Nor oppress the afflicted at the gate
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơgŏ iŏk tơmam lu bơngai dơnuh hoh; Noh yua kơ sư dơnuh hin răm boih. Kŭm 'nĕ pơjuă pơđep lu bơngai pơmat-tat 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei.

English: For the LORD will plead their cause, And plunder the soul of those who plunder them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang gô dŏng lu sư, Gô iŏk lê̆ tơdrong arih đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơgar iŏk tơmam lu sư.

English: Make no friendship with an angry man, And with a furious man do not go
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơm buăl juăt hăm bơngai khĕnh Păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ năm hơdai lu bơngai 'bônh kơ blĕk.

English: Lest you learn his ways And set a snare for your soul.
Bahnar: Kơnh hli kơ ih rok kiơ̆ trong sư Păng bơhngol ih gô 'leh hơđong sư.

English: Do not be one of those who shakes hands in a pledge, One of those who is surety for debts
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơgơ̆p hơdai lu bơngai pơkă rôp ti, Dah wă pơkă chă mơng hre kơ đe

English: If you have nothing with which to pay, Why should he take away your bed from under you?
Bahnar: Tơdah ih 'mong kơ hre ưh kơ đei, lei đei yua kiơ kơ ih gô hiong giơng ih tep.

English: Do not remove the ancient landmark Which your fathers have set.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ rĭ 'long pơ̆ng hơdral so, đơ̆ng mĕ 'bă yă 'bok pơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: Do you see a man who excels in his work? He will stand before kings; He will not stand before unknown men.
Bahnar: Ih hăm 'bôh ưh lu bơngai hơgei đei jang tơnăp? Sư gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu pơtao sư ưh kơ dơ̆ng hơdai 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai hmă.

English: When you sit down to eat with a ruler, Consider carefully what is before you
Bahnar: Tơdah ih hơ-oei sŏng sa hơdai hăm bơngai pơgơ̆r Kơchăng bĕ kơ bơngai 'bơ̆t anăp ih.

English: And put a knife to your throat If you are a man given to appetite.
Bahnar: Dan bĕ săng 'bơ̆t dăng-hơlŏng ih tơdah ih sa dư.

English: Do not desire his delicacies, For they are deceptive food.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ham sa tơmam 'lơ̆ng sư Yua kơ tơmam sŏng sa 'noh.

English: Do not overwork to be rich; Because of your own understanding, cease!
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơgleh ih kơdih kơlih wă kơ mơdrŏng. Ăn kơ ih đei đon hơgei 'nei hloh kơ tơdrong noh.

English: Will you set your eyes on that which is not? For riches certainly make themselves wings; They fly away like an eagle toward heaven.
Bahnar: Măt ih nŏng kơ lăng 'bloh tơ mơdrŏng hă? Ưh pă đei boih! Yua kơ sư đĭ chăt pơnăr păr tŏk tơ plĕnh thoi sem kring.

English: Do not eat the bread of a miser, Nor desire his delicacies
Bahnar: 'Nĕ sa tơmam lu bơngai kret tơsen; 'Nĕ kơ ham sa tơmam 'băt 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng sư.

English: For as he thinks in his heart, so is he. “Eat and drink!” he says to you, But his heart is not with you.
Bahnar: Sư tơchĕng lăm jơhngơ̆m thoi yơ, sư thoi ei; Sư khan, sŏng sa, et sa bĕ; Mă-lei jơhngơ̆m sư ưh kơ đei thoi ei ôh.

English: The morsel you have eaten, you will vomit up, And waste your pleasant words.
Bahnar: Ih gô hăk lê̆ tơmam đêl ih sa. Nơ̆r ih bơnê gô hiong tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Do not speak in the hearing of a fool, For he will despise the wisdom of your words.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơma lăm hla đon bơngai kơtul, Yua kơ sư gô pơjăm nơ̆r ih pơma hơgei.

English: Do not remove the ancient landmark, Nor enter the fields of the fatherless
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ rĭ 'long pơ̆ng hơdral so, Na pơ̆ng pơtăm lăm chŭn mir lu bơngai mơti

English: For their Redeemer is mighty; He will plead their cause against you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư noh mơsêh mơyang, Gô dŏng lu sư, na blah ih.

English: Apply your heart to instruction, And your ears to words of knowledge.
Bahnar: Athei đĭ jơhngơ̆m kơ nơ̆r bơtho. Hăm pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r hlôh wao.

English: Do not withhold correction from a child, For if you beat him with a rod, he will not die.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ lê̆ teh bơtho kon hơ'lơ̆p. Mă teh sư hăm sơnguĕt tơlei sư huay kơ lôch ôh.

English: You shall beat him with a rod, And deliver his soul from hell.
Bahnar: Teh bơtho sư hăm 'long sơnguĕt, 'Lơ̆ng hloh noh wă pơklaih sư đơ̆ng Dơnâu ŭnh.

English: My son, if your heart is wise, My heart will rejoice—indeed, I myself
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, dah lăm jơhngơ̆m ih hơgei lei jơhngơ̆m inh kư̆m hiôk chơt.

English: Yes, my inmost being will rejoice When your lips speak right things.
Bahnar: Klơm klak inh kư̆m gô chơt hiôk. Dah nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ih pơma tơpăt.

English: Do not let your heart envy sinners, But be zealous for the fear of the LORD all the day
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn jơhngơ̆m ih arih 'ngeng kơ lu bơngai yoch. Mă-lei athei arih băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang rim năr.

English: For surely there is a hereafter, And your hope will not be cut off.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă ih wă gô đei apah ning-mônh. Păng tơdrong mă ih hơmĕng gô đei huay kơ tôch.

English: Hear, my son, and be wise; And guide your heart in the way.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ ơ dăm! Na ih gô gơh hơgei; Wei ba jơhngơ̆m ih lăm trong tơpăt.

English: Do not mix with winebibbers, Or with gluttonous eaters of meat
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơm juăt hăm lu bơngai suai sik, dah hăm lu bơngai sa dư kơhô.

English: For the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty, And drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai suai sik păng sa dư kơhô gô jing dơnuh răm; Hăm lu bơngai sa, ĭch 'bĭch tep gô hrŭk hơbĕn ao hiah.

English: Listen to your father who begot you, And do not despise your mother when she is old.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r 'bă mă bơngai pơjing kơ ih; 'Nĕ areh kơ mĕ đĭ kră pă kĕ jang.

English: Buy the truth, and do not sell it, Also wisdom and instruction and understanding.
Bahnar: Răt bĕ tơdrong sĭt tơpă, 'nĕ kơ tĕch lê̆. Iŏk tơdrong hơgei wei nơ̆r bơtho pơhrăm păng hlôh wao

English: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice, And he who begets a wise child will delight in him.
Bahnar: Hiôk tơpă 'bă bơngai tơpăt, Mă đei kon gơh hơgei gô đei chơt hiôk kơ sư.

English: Let your father and your mother be glad, And let her who bore you rejoice.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ mĕ 'bă ih chơt hiôk, Ăn kơ bu hơiơch kơ ih 'nă hal.

English: My son, give me your heart, And let your eyes observe my ways.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, pơjao bĕ jơhngơ̆m ih kơ inh; Măt ih kơchăm rok kiơ̆ trong inh.

English: For a harlot is a deep pit, And a seductress is a narrow well.
Bahnar: Yua kơ drŏ-kăn đi thoi sơlŭng jrŭ Păng drŏ-kăn luĕl 'blal thoi sơlŭng hrăt.

English: She also lies in wait as for a victim, And increases the unfaithful among men.
Bahnar: Sư răp chop thoi bơngai tơtông, Chông thim lơ lăm lu kon bơngai pơm kư̆ kă kuă kơ lui

English: Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has contentions? Who has complaints? Who has wounds without cause? Who has redness of eyes?
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei tơdrong pơmat? Bơngai bu đei tơdrong sơ'ngon bơngai bu đei tơdrong tơhil băl? Bơngai bu jĭ rơka tơdrong kơ đei bơngai bu mă đei măt 'breo?

English: Those who linger long at the wine, Those who go in search of mixed wine.
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ bơngai oei đom 'bơ̆t tơm tơdrô boih păng mă lu et bơlŭk yơh

English: Do not look on the wine when it is red, When it sparkles in the cup, When it swirls around smoothly
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ lăng pơnhen tơ tơdrô, kơplah ih 'bôh sư oei choh đak oei blôk ro 'bônh.

English: At the last it bites like a serpent, And stings like a viper.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng sư jŏng choh thoi 'bih kăp jĭ thoi hơguăt.

English: Your eyes will see strange things, And your heart will utter perverse things.
Bahnar: Măt ih gô lăng păng pơglăn hlĭch, Jơhngơ̆m ih jing pha nơ̆r pơma, ih jing kơnê̆.

English: Yes, you will be like one who lies down in the midst of the sea, Or like one who lies at the top of the mast, saying
Bahnar: Sĭt, ih jing thoi bơngai 'bĭch tep lăm đak dơsĭ, Thoi 'bĭch kơpal kơ̆l jrăng đe dăng che thŏng-nan.

English: “They have struck me, but I was not hurt; They have beaten me, but I did not feel it. When shall I awake, that I may seek another drink?”
Bahnar: Ih khan: Đe teh inh, mă-lei huay kơ jĭ. Đe dong inh, mă-lei inh ưh kơ băt, Layơ inh hơdơ̆r, inh gô chă wă et dơ̆ng.

English: Do not be envious of evil men, Nor desire to be with them
Bahnar: 'Nĕ 'ngeng kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Ih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ wă 'maih oei hơdai hăm sư.

English: For their heart devises violence, And their lips talk of troublemaking.
Bahnar: Yua kơ jơhngơ̆m lu sư chă wă pơrăm đe, Hơpiĕt lu sư pơma chă dơhla pơrŭng đe.

English: Through wisdom a house is built, And by understanding it is established
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei đei pơm tơiung hnam. Đơ̆ng đon hlôh wao na hnam đei pơm pơjing kơjăp.

English: By knowledge the rooms are filled With all precious and pleasant riches.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng gơh hơgei na đei lơ anih 'bĕnh tơmam gĭt păng 'lơ̆ng.

English: A wise man is strong, Yes, a man of knowledge increases strength
Bahnar: Bơngai gơh hơgei đei pran kơtang. Bơngai hlôh wao gô thim tơdrong pran.

English: For by wise counsel you will wage your own war, And in a multitude of counselors there is safety.
Bahnar: Ih athei đei chă đon hlôh wao na năm tơblah. Gô jei jơnei tih dah ih đei lơ bơngai bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: Wisdom is too lofty for a fool; He does not open his mouth in the gate.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơgei oei kơjung dêh kơ lu bơngai kơtul, Sư kơđei ha 'bơ̆r pơma ôh 'bơ̆t 'măng jang.

English: He who plots to do evil Will be called a schemer.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wă chă tơdrong pơm kơnê̆. Đe jô̆ sư bơngai chă hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: The devising of foolishness is sin, And the scoffer is an abomination to men.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơchĕng wă pơm lĕch đơ̆ng kơhlôh kơwao noh yoch. Bơngai juăt kơ hiap đe areh dêh.

English: If you faint in the day of adversity, Your strength is small.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih rơdu klai lăm năr đei tơdrong gleh, Noh tơdrong pran kơtang ih iĕ dêh.

English: Deliver those who are drawn toward death, And hold back those stumbling to the slaughter.
Bahnar: Dŏng pơklaih bĕ lu bơngai wă năm lăm trong lôch. Păng dŏng pơklaih bĕ lu bơngai mă đe ba wă pơlôch.

English: If you say, “Surely we did not know this,” Does not He who weighs the hearts consider it? He who keeps your soul, does He not know it? And will He not render to each man according to his deeds?
Bahnar: Tơdah ih khan, “'Nâu, nhôn ưh kơ băt ôh tơdrong noh” Hăm trŏ đei tơ'ngla 'bôh boih tơdrong noh? Hăm trŏ đei tơ'ngla wei-lăng bơhngol ih sư 'bôh tơdrong noh? Sư gô pơm tơwih kơ rim 'nu kiơ̆ thoi đêl sư pơm

English: My son, eat honey because it is good, And the honeycomb which is sweet to your taste
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, sa bĕ đak sut, yua kơ sư 'ngam 'lơ̆ng. Kơ̆l sal sut jing 'ngam kơ hơlŏng ih.

English: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be to your soul; If you have found it, there is a prospect, And your hope will not be cut off.
Bahnar: Ih athei băt tơdrong hơgei kư̆m đei 'ngam lăm bơhngol ih thoi noh; Dah ih chă tơdrong hơgei đei boih, ih gô đei tơdrong hiôk chơt đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp. Păng tơdrong ih chang hơmĕng ưh kơ tôch ôh.

English: Do not lie in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; Do not plunder his resting place
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Lê̆ kơ răp chop hnam bơngai tơpăt; 'Nĕ kơ pơrăm ôh anih sư oei.

English: For a righteous man may fall seven times And rise again, But the wicked shall fall by calamity.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai tơpăt mă sư pơ̆k tơpơh wơ̆t ră, Mă-lei gô iung dơ̆ng; Mă-lei bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô pơrăm hăm pơmat-tat.

English: Do not rejoice when your enemy falls, And do not let your heart be glad when he stumbles
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ chhôk tơdah bơngai ayăt kơ ih pơ̆k huŏng; Jơhngơ̆m 'nĕ kơ hal, năr jei ih

English: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease Him, And He turn away His wrath from him.
Bahnar: Kơnh Kră Yang 'bôh tơdrong noh Sư ưh kơ lăp đon. Na ưh pă hil kơ sư.

English: Do not fret because of evildoers, Nor be envious of the wicked
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ ơh lăng lu bơngai kơnê̆; Lê̆ kơ klai areh lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆ 'brư̆

English: For there will be no prospect for the evil man; The lamp of the wicked will be put out.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ ưh kơ lê̆ đunh ôh, Ŭnh kơđeng hu sư gô păt.

English: My son, fear the LORD and the king; Do not associate with those given to change
Bahnar: Ơ dăm hli yom bĕ kơ Kră Yang păng chu yom kơ pơtao; 'Nĕ pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: For their calamity will rise suddenly, And who knows the ruin those two can bring?
Bahnar: Yua kơ blư đei tơdrong kơnê̆ truh hloi tơ lu sư. Bu băt lê̆ tơdrong truh kơ bơngai âu dah bơngai to?

English: These things also belong to the wise: It is not good to show partiality in judgment.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r 'nâu gơh đei lĕch đơ̆ng bơngai hơgei pơma; Sek tơlang 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t minh pah ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng.

English: He who says to the wicked, “You are righteous,” Him the people will curse; Nations will abhor him.
Bahnar: Bu khan kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ ih huay kơ yoch ôh, Kon pơlei gô blei hiap, bơngai lăm teh đak hil areh kơ sư.

English: But those who rebuke the wicked will have delight, And a good blessing will come upon them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai bu chrih kơ bơngai pơm yoch đei chơt hiôk. Tơdrong pŭn hiôk truh tơ lu sư.

English: He who gives a right answer kisses the lips.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu drơ̆ng lăp kiăp trŏ noh thoi chŭm 'bơ̆t 'bơ̆r.

English: Prepare your outside work, Make it fit for yourself in the field; And afterward build your house.
Bahnar: Pơm đang tơdrong jang ih tơ 'nguaih pơgar bĕ, choh bĕ mir na ih; Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh pơm bĕ hnam ih.

English: Do not be a witness against your neighbor without cause, For would you deceive with your lips?
Bahnar: 'Nĕ chă pơm tơdrong kơđei oei sa kơnê̆ hăm rông 'bôt ih; 'Nĕ yua 'bơ̆r nơ̆r pơma pơhlŭ hơlĕnh?

English: Do not say, “I will do to him just as he has done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ chă pơma: Inh gô pơm kơ sư thoi sư pơm kơ inh; Inh gô pơm 'mong kiơ̆ tơdrong đêl sư pơm.

English: I went by the field of the lazy man, And by the vineyard of the man devoid of understanding
Bahnar: Inh rok boih trong mir bơngai hơlah, Păng lăng boih pơgar hơmu bơngai kơwao.

English: And there it was, all overgrown with thorns; Its surface was covered with nettles; Its stone wall was broken down.
Bahnar: 'Long 'nhĕt jơla jơ̆p kơ mir na sư, 'nhĕt jơla chăt 'bĕnh kơ teh. Păng dur man păng tơmo to đĭ păk boih.

English: When I saw it, I considered it well; I looked on it and received instruction
Bahnar: Inh lăng păng hơlen tơ noh. 'Bôh hŏk iŏk pơhrăm.

English: A little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to rest
Bahnar: Tep 'biơ̆ pơdơh 'biơ̆, Kuăr ti 'biơ̆.

English: So shall your poverty come like a prowler, And your need like an armed man.
Bahnar: Lei tơdrong dơnuh gô truh kơ ih thoi bơngai ayăt. Păng tơdrong kơ'bah gô truh thoi bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah oei tơblah.

English: These also are proverbs of Solomon which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong pơđơ̆k đơ̆ng Sôlômôn, mă lu buăl Hesekia pơtao đe Juđa chih răk dơ̆ng.

English: It is the glory of God to conceal a matter, But the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong kiơ oei hlơp, noh boih tơdrong ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong lu pơtao chơchă wă kơ băt noh tơdrong ư-ang kơ lu sư.

English: As the heavens for height and the earth for depth, So the heart of kings is unsearchable.
Bahnar: Plĕnh kơjung dang yơ. Teh jrŭ dang yơ, Na jơhngơ̆m lu pơtao đe ưh kơ băt thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Take away the dross from silver, And it will go to the silversmith for jewelry.
Bahnar: Iŏk lê̆ bĕ ĭch hu. Na lu bơngai tuh hling jing đei tơmam gĭt.

English: Take away the wicked from before the king, And his throne will be established in righteousness.
Bahnar: Iŏk lê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đơ̆ng anăp pơtao. Na tang-dŏ pơtao pơjing kơjăp 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Do not exalt yourself in the presence of the king, And do not stand in the place of the great
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơư ih kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao, Dah hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anih lu đe ư-ang

English: For it is better that he say to you, “Come up here,” Than that you should be put lower in the presence of the prince, Whom your eyes have seen.
Bahnar: 'Lơ̆ng hloh đe khan: Apinh ih, tŏk tơ âu. Noh hloh kơ sư tơjur ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu yŏng pơgơ̆r.

English: Do not go hastily to court; For what will you do in the end, When your neighbor has put you to shame?
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ măt ih 'bôh boih, 'Nĕ kơ hăt tơbăt kơ 'bok sek tơlang. Kơnh, kon pơlei oei jê̆ ih lu sư 'bôh plơ̆ng gô pơm kơ ih mơlâu 'Nâu tuch-luch ih wă pơm liơ.

English: Debate your case with your neighbor, And do not disclose the secret to another
Bahnar: Tơdah ih pơjah chă lăp hăm lu bơngai rông 'bôt ih. Ih 'nĕ roi pơdah tơdrong hlơp bơngai nai.

English: Lest he who hears it expose your shame, And your reputation be ruined.
Bahnar: Hli kơ đe mơ̆ng tơdrong noh hơloh chrih kơ ih. Đe ang tơdrong jang kơnê̆ ưh kơ sŭt đĭ.

English: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold In settings of silver.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơma trŏ lăp noh, Thoi plei hơra 'maih dan kơpal pơnhan hu.

English: Like an earring of gold and an ornament of fine gold Is a wise rebuker to an obedient ear.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơgei chrih kơ đon bơngai oei mơ̆ng. Thoi gŏp maih, tơmam đe pơguăng păng maih ling.

English: Like the cold of snow in time of harvest Is a faithful messenger to those who send him, For he refreshes the soul of his masters.
Bahnar: Bơngai đe wơh tơnăp hăm yŏng sư Thoi 'mui prĕl rơngơp bơyan yuă 'ba. Yua kơ pơm kơ bơhngol yŏng tơ'ngla sư hiôk.

English: Whoever falsely boasts of giving Is like clouds and wind without rain.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơkă wă ăn tơmam, Mă-lei ưh kơ đei ăn. Thoi hơmơ̆l 'mi đei kial jor kơ 'mi dơ̆ng.

English: By long forbearance a ruler is persuaded, And a gentle tongue breaks a bone.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrin chơ̆n na gơh pơtơm bơngai pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r chu. Hơpiĕt pơma huăt rơdu lu kơting 'bônh kơ tơgơ̆.

English: Have you found honey? Eat only as much as you need, Lest you be filled with it and vomit.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih 'bôh đak sut sa sư lăp ai; Sa lơ 'bơ'blut kơnh ih hăk lê̆.

English: Seldom set foot in your neighbor’s house, Lest he become weary of you and hate you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ gan năm ngôi tơ hnam bôl buăl ih, Kơnh hli kơ sư bơ̆l hăl băl lap hil plơ̆ kơ ih.

English: A man who bears false witness against his neighbor Is like a club, a sword, and a sharp arrow.
Bahnar: Bơngai chă hơlĕnh sơlam kơ rông 'bôt sư. Bơngai noh thoi 'long băl, thoi đao gưm, dah thoi 'brơ̆m suĕng.

English: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble Is like a bad tooth and a foot out of joint.
Bahnar: Lui ngeh kơ bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr năr đei tơdrong pơmat. Thoi kơkă hăm hơnĕnh tơgơ̆, thoi yak hăm jơ̆ng tơplơ̆ tơpling.

English: Like one who takes away a garment in cold weather, And like vinegar on soda, Is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.
Bahnar: Bu hơri kơ đe năr đe ơh sơ'ngon. Thoi plôh ao hơ'bơ̆l năr tơngiĕt. Thoi tuh đak iŭ tơ đak Sôđa.

English: If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat; And if he is thirsty, give him water to drink
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai ayăt kơ ih pơngot ăn kơ sư sŏng sa. Tơdah rơhing kơ đak, ăn kơ sư nhă

English: For so you will heap coals of fire on his head, And the LORD will reward you.
Bahnar: Thoi ih dan ngar ngŭr kơpal kơ̆l sư, Thoi ei lei na Kră Yang gô apah bơnê kơ ih.

English: The north wind brings forth rain, And a backbiting tongue an angry countenance.
Bahnar: Kial đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m ba đak 'mi. Hơpiĕt ayơ roi sa pơma krŭl pơm kơ đe blĕk.

English: It is better to dwell in a corner of a housetop, Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m oei 'bơ̆t chaih jih bơbŭng hnam 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ oei lăm hnam hơdai hăm akăn mơkoh.

English: As cold water to a weary soul, So is good news from a far country.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nao tơbăt 'lơ̆ng truh đơ̆ng char ataih. Thoi đak rơngơp pơchhơp bơngai rơhing.

English: A righteous man who falters before the wicked Is like a murky spring and a polluted well.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt huŏng lăm bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơhlŭ. Thoi đak sơlŭng gơsŏk đĭ, thoi đak mơlĕch mơgrĭ boih.

English: It is not good to eat much honey; So to seek one’s own glory is not glory.
Bahnar: Sa đak sut lơ hnang ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Bơngai pơrơ̆ng chă wă kơ đe ư-ang kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: Whoever has no rule over his own spirit Is like a city broken down, without walls.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ băt pơgơ̆r jơhngơ̆m sư kơdih. Bơngai noh thoi minh pôm pơlei tih dur đĭ păk.

English: As snow in summer and rain in harvest, So honor is not fitting for a fool.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơyom ưh kơ lăp hăm lu bơngai bơlŭk. Thoi prĕl bơyan phang, thoi 'mi bơyan kĕch.

English: Like a flitting sparrow, like a flying swallow, So a curse without cause shall not alight.
Bahnar: Thoi sem rĕch păr tơ âu tơ to, Thoi sem pleng păr juang suang plơ̆ plĕch. Nơ̆r đe hiap tơdrong kơ đei huay kơ truh ôh.

English: A whip for the horse, A bridle for the donkey, And a rod for the fool’s back.
Bahnar: Tơnguĕt yua teh aseh, dam pơhơ̆p ăn aseh iĕ. 'Long băl 'măn kơ teh rŏng lu bơngai kơtul.

English: Do not answer a fool according to his folly, Lest you also be like him.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ tơl tơwih 'bih bơngai kơwao thoi tơdrong kơtul sư. Hli kơ ih jing nhen ten thoi sư.

English: Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own eyes.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ tơl tơwih kơ bơngai kơwao thoi tơdrong kơtul sư. Kơnh sư khan sư bơngai hơgei đei đon hlôh wao.

English: He who sends a message by the hand of a fool Cuts off his own feet and drinks violence.
Bahnar: Bu gơnang kơ bơngai kơwao năm roi tơbăt kơ đe. Thoi koh lê̆ jơ̆ng chơ̆ng lê̆ blu sư kơdih păng huch iŏk tơdrong răm.

English: Like the legs of the lame that hang limp Is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơđơ̆k lăm 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơtul kơwao. Kŭm thoi jơ̆ng bơngai jo ưh kơ gơh yak.

English: Like one who binds a stone in a sling Is he who gives honor to a fool.
Bahnar: Pơyom kơ bơngai kơhlôh kơwao. Thoi tah tơmo lăm hră tơ'bla.

English: Like a thorn that goes into the hand of a drunkard Is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơđơ̆k lăm 'bơ̆r lu bơngai kơtul kơwao. Thoi jơla trŏ ti bơngai suai sik.

English: The great God who formed everything Gives the fool his hire and the transgressor his wages.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mưng bơngai kơtul kơwao păng bơngai tơmoi rok trong. Thoi minh 'nu bơngai prah hră 'bơm lơ bơngai rơka.

English: As a dog returns to his own vomit, So a fool repeats his folly.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơhlôh pơm pơlơ̆k ming tơdrong kơtul sư. Thoi kŏ hăk boih sa dơ̆ng.

English: Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
Bahnar: Ih hăm 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai khan kơ sư kơdih bơngai hlôh wao, Bơngai kơtul bơlŭk oei đei hơmĕng hloh kơ sư.

English: The lazy man says, “There is a lion in the road! A fierce lion is in the streets!”
Bahnar: Bơngai hơlah khan đei dăm-brang tơ trong. Đei minh pôm dăm-brang tơ rok trong pơlei to!

English: As a door turns on its hinges, So does the lazy man on his bed.
Bahnar: 'Măng dăr plơ̆ plĕch kơ gơwŏk sư thoi yơ bơngai hơlah 'bĭch plơ̆ plĕch kơ giơng sư kư̆m thoi noh.

English: The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; It wearies him to bring it back to his mouth.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơlah chro ti lăm pơnhan, Kŭm hơnat pat pơmat dêh wă tah tơ lăm 'bơ̆r.

English: The lazy man is wiser in his own eyes Than seven men who can answer sensibly.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơlah khan sư hlôh wao, Hloh mă đei tơpơh 'nu tơl lăp kư̆m tim mă tam sư.

English: He who passes by and meddles in a quarrel not his own Is like one who takes a dog by the ears.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu yak rok trong drong mơ̆t tơhil tơdrong noh ưh kơ 'bơm sư. Thoi bơngai mă pet wĕnh đon kŏ.

English: Like a madman who throws firebrands, arrows, and death
Bahnar: Thoi bơngai wơnh prah ngar ŭnh ngŭr, 'Brơ̆m păng tơdrong lôch.

English: Is the man who deceives his neighbor, And says, “I was only joking!”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hơlĕnh sơlam kơ rông 'bôt sư, păng khan: Inh hơnul đĕch măi!

English: Where there is no wood, the fire goes out; And where there is no talebearer, strife ceases.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei 'long ŭnh, ŭnh păt; Dah ưh kơ đei roi sơlam lei tơdrong tơhil pơjah gô pơdơh.

English: As charcoal is to burning coals, and wood to fire, So is a contentious man to kindle strife.
Bahnar: Ngar soh lăm ŭnh jing ngŭr, 'long ŭnh tơkuh lăm ŭnh jing khơ̆ng, Bơngai juăt tơhil kư̆m ngăl pơm kơ đe tơhil băl thoi noh.

English: The words of a talebearer are like tasty trifles, And they go down into the inmost body.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r lu bơngai sơlam hơlĕnh 'ngam thoi tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng. Mơ̆t jrŭ truh tơ klơm tơ klak.

English: Fervent lips with a wicked heart Are like earthenware covered with silver dross.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r pơma 'lơ̆ng, mă-lei đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆, Thoi ge gŏ teh đe pik hu gah 'nguaih.

English: He who hates, disguises it with his lips, And lays up deceit within himself
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hil areh, pơm 'brach gah 'nguaih praih pơrŏ. Lăm jơhngơ̆m hơ-ơ̆m oei răk tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: When he speaks kindly, do not believe him, For there are seven abominations in his heart
Bahnar: Tơdah sư pơma 'ngam 'nĕ kơ lui kơ sư. Yua kơ sư đei tơpơh tŏ tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Though his hatred is covered by deceit, His wickedness will be revealed before the assembly.
Bahnar: Mă sư ôn hlơp tơdrong hil chă pơm pơrŏ, Tơdrong trŏ khĕnh hơwĕng sư gô lĕch tơ tơpôl 'bôh.

English: Whoever digs a pit will fall into it, And he who rolls a stone will have it roll back on him.
Bahnar: Bu sir sơlŭng sư gô huŏng tơ lăm noh, Bu tơgrŏl tơmo, tơmo gô grŏl kơtĭt plơ̆ sư.

English: A lying tongue hates those who are crushed by it, And a flattering mouth works ruin.
Bahnar: Hơpiĕt hơlĕnh areh lu bơngai sư pơjuă; Mă 'bơ̆r lu sư pơma pơkă wă pơrăm.

English: Do not boast about tomorrow, For you do not know what a day may bring forth.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơư kơ năr dơning, Yua kơ ih ưh kơ băt năr dơning sư jing liơ.

English: Let another man praise you, and not your own mouth; A stranger, and not your own lips.
Bahnar: Lê̆ kơ đe pơư kơ ih, kơdih akâu ih 'nĕ kơ pơma 'bơm. Lê̆ kơ đe pơư pơma, tơ'ngla ih 'nĕ yua 'bơ̆r ih kơdih ôh.

English: A stone is heavy and sand is weighty, But a fool’s wrath is heavier than both of them.
Bahnar: Tơmo trăp, chuơh kư̆m trăp, Mă-lei đei pơdrŭt lu bơngai kơtul kơwao noh trăp hloh kơ 'bar noh.

English: Wrath is cruel and anger a torrent, But who is able to stand before jealousy?
Bahnar: Tơdrong hil mĭl kơnê̆ tơpă, Tơdrong hil thoi đak lĕch ro blai lơ̆p, Bu kĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp tơdrong hil gar.

English: Open rebuke is better Than love carefully concealed.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m chrih hơdah tơm măt noh, 'Lơ̆ng hloh khan 'mêm mă-lei oei ngâm lăm to.

English: Faithful are the wounds of a friend, But the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
Bahnar: Buăl juăt pơjĭ bơ̆n rơka, noh 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m tơpăt. Bơngai ayăt hil chŭm hơlêm khan 'mêm noh hơlĕnh.

English: A satisfied soul loathes the honeycomb, But to a hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai phĭ đĭ kuă pơjuă lê̆ kơ̆l hơkoh sut tơ ala jơ̆ng. Mă-lei lu bơngai pơngot mă sa tăng lăng thoi 'ngam.

English: Like a bird that wanders from its nest Is a man who wanders from his place.
Bahnar: Bơngai thông mang huang ataih đơ̆ng hnam sư, Thoi sem păr ataih đơ̆ng tơpu sư.

English: Ointment and perfume delight the heart, And the sweetness of a man’s friend gives delight by hearty counsel.
Bahnar: Tơmam 'bâu phu păng pơgang 'bâu phu pik pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m hiôk chơt. Nơ̆r pơlung đơ̆ng lu bôl buăl kư̆m hiôk chhơp thoi noh.

English: Do not forsake your own friend or your father’s friend, Nor go to your brother’s house in the day of your calamity; Better is a neighbor nearby than a brother far away.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ achăng bôl buăl ih dah buăl juăt 'bă ih, 'Nĕ kơ năm tơ hnam 'nhŏng oh năr ih đei tơdrong gleh pơmat, Bơngai rông 'bôt ih noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ 'nhŏng oei ataih.

English: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, That I may answer him who reproaches me.
Bahnar: Ơ dăm, mă gơh hơgei, lei na pơm pơhiôk jơhngơ̆m inh, Wă kơ gơh tơl tơwih kơ bơngai mă pơm kơ inh mơlâu.

English: A prudent man foresees evil and hides himself; The simple pass on and are punished.
Bahnar: Bơngai gơh hơgei đei tơdrong gleh băt weh ôn. Bơngai kơtul kơwao kư̆ năm tơ anăp, răp pŭ răm.

English: Take the garment of him who is surety for a stranger, And hold it in pledge when he is surety for a seductress.
Bahnar: Rôp pơkơ̆ng hơbĕn ao đơ̆ng sư pơkă wă pơkăm kơ bơngai tơmoi; Sư athei đei tơmam pơdơ̆ng đơ̆ng nơ̆r sư pơkă wă pơkăm kơ drŏ-kăn đi.

English: He who blesses his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, It will be counted a curse to him.
Bahnar: Bu iung đơ̆ng hrôih drôih sơkat pŭn hiôk kơ rông 'bôt sư hăm nơ̆r re ôr. Nơ̆r noh đe jô̆ nơ̆r hiap pơtê̆.

English: A continual dripping on a very rainy day And a contentious woman are alike
Bahnar: Hngăt lĕch ling-lang năr 'mi tih, Thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn mơkoh noh tơhil ling-lang

English: Whoever restrains her restrains the wind, And grasps oil with his right hand.
Bahnar: Bu wă khă sư, thoi khă kial, Kŭm thoi tơpang ti 'ma rôp kơđôp rơmă.

English: As iron sharpens iron, So a man sharpens the countenance of his friend.
Bahnar: Bơsei pat bơsei suĕng, Kŭm thoi bơngai pat pơhrăm buăl sư.

English: Whoever keeps the fig tree will eat its fruit; So he who waits on his master will be honored.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu bơwei tơm hơra, gô sa plei sư; Bu chu bơwei yŏng sư, đe gô pơyom.

English: As in water face reflects face, So a man’s heart reveals the man.
Bahnar: Lăng muh măt lăm đak 'bôh thoi yơ. Jơhngơ̆m bơngai kư̆m tơ'bôh thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Hell and Destruction are never full; So the eyes of man are never satisfied.
Bahnar: Măt kon bơngai lăng ưh kơ đei layơ bơ̆l hăl. Dêh atâu păng lôch răm ưh kơ đei layơ hrăp.

English: The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold, And a man is valued by what others say of him.
Bahnar: Anih 'buh hu wă rơgoh, tơnuh ŭnh soh maih wă kơ hlăng; Mă-lei đe lăng jơhngơ̆m bơngai thoi đe bơnê kơ sư noh.

English: Though you grind a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with crushed grain, Yet his foolishness will not depart from him.
Bahnar: Mă ih iŏk hơdrei peh hrol lu bơngai kơhlôh kơwao lăm tơpăl, hăm 'ba. Tơdrong kơhlôh kơwao sư oei ưh kơ tơkloh đơ̆ng sư ôh.

English: Be diligent to know the state of your flocks, And attend to your herds
Bahnar: Ih lăng băt kơnăl kơ triu ih sư thoi yơ, Păng bơwei lu khŭl rơmo ih mă 'lơ̆ng.

English: For riches are not forever, Nor does a crown endure to all generations.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơdrŏng ưh kơ đei oei ling-lang ôh, Mă jing pơtao kư̆m ưh kơ ling-lang mơ̆n.

English: When the hay is removed, and the tender grass shows itself, And the herbs of the mountains are gathered in
Bahnar: 'Nhĕt kro hiong đĭ, 'nhĕt hơdrih bluh plơ̆ng, 'Nhĕt 'nhot lăm bri kông đe phĕ broch akŭm.

English: The lambs will provide your clothing, And the goats the price of a field
Bahnar: Sŏk triu pơm hơbĕn ao tai ih hrŭk, Bơbe bram tĕch pơm tơmam răt chŭn mir.

English: You shall have enough goats’ milk for your food, For the food of your household, And the nourishment of your maidservants.
Bahnar: Đak toh bơbe pơm tơmam sa kơ ih hăm lu bơngai lăm hnam, Ih păng kơ lu đam drŏ-kăn ih arih sa.

English: The wicked flee when no one pursues, But the righteous are bold as a lion.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơdâu ôn mă ưh kơ đei bu druh. Mă-lei lu bơngai oei arih tơpăt nuih thoi dăm-brang.

English: Because of the transgression of a land, many are its princes; But by a man of understanding and knowledge Right will be prolonged.
Bahnar: Dêh char pơm kơnê̆, na đei lơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r; Mă-lei bơngai hlôh wao na pơgơ̆r dêh char gei oei kơjăp đunh.

English: A poor man who oppresses the poor Is like a driving rain which leaves no food.
Bahnar: Bơngai dơnuh pơgŏ pơđep bơngai pơmat-tat. Nhen thoi đak 'mi tih pơhoch đĭ 'ba hơ'bo.

English: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, But such as keep the law contend with them.
Bahnar: Bơngai achăng lê̆ khôi juăt hăt bơnê kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆; Mă-lei đei bơngai kiơ̆ khôi juăt tơblah hăm lu sư.

English: Evil men do not understand justice, But those who seek the LORD understand all.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đê̆ pă băt tơdrong tơpăt; Mă-lei đei bơngai bu băt chă Kră Yang na băt hlôh đĭ-đăng.

English: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity Than one perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m dơnuh hoh oei sa tơpăt. 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ mơdrŏng nŏng kiơ̆ tơdrong hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: Whoever keeps the law is a discerning son, But a companion of gluttons shames his father.
Bahnar: Bu wei răk khôi juăt noh kon drŏ-nglo bơngai hơgei; Gah bu pơm juăt hăm lu bơngai sa dư noh wă pơm kơ 'bă sư mơlâu.

English: One who increases his possessions by usury and extortion Gathers it for him who will pity the poor.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm kơ mơdrŏng rai tŏk iŏk đơ̆ng sa kiĕng lơ. Jên kăk răt pơpôi ăn kơ bơngai băt mơnat kơ lu dơnuh hin.

English: One who turns away his ear from hearing the law, Even his prayer is an abomination.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă kuă pơgling đon mơ̆ng kiơ̆ khôi juăt. Nơ̆r krao apinh sư Kră Yang areh krưp.

English: Whoever causes the upright to go astray in an evil way, He himself will fall into his own pit; But the blameless will inherit good.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ba lu bơngai tơpăt kiơ̆ trong kơnê̆. Gô huŏng lăm sơlŭng đêl lu sư sir; Mă-lei đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: The rich man is wise in his own eyes, But the poor who has understanding searches him out.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdrŏng dŏng kơdih akâu khan bơngai hơgei. Mă-lei đei bơngai dơnuh hlôh 'bôh đĭ bơngai noh?

English: When the righteous rejoice, there is great glory; But when the wicked arise, men hide themselves.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai tơpăt jei jơnei, đei hiôk chơt tih; Mă-lei đei bơngai pơm kơnê̆ iung lei đei bơngai kơdâu ôn.

English: He who covers his sins will not prosper, But whoever confesses and forsakes them will have mercy.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ôn tơdrong yoch sư ưh kơ đei pŭn hiôk; Mă-lei đei bu tơbral păng achăng lê̆ sư gô đei mơnat.

English: Happy is the man who is always reverent, But he who hardens his heart will fall into calamity.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang gô đei pŭn hiôk; Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu arăng kơ̆l gô răm.

English: Like a roaring lion and a charging bear Is a wicked ruler over poor people.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơnê̆ pơgơ̆r kon pơlei dơnuh hin; Nhen thoi dăm-brang grĕnh gơhuh nhen thoi chơgơu druh sem bri wă rôp sa.

English: A ruler who lacks understanding is a great oppressor, But he who hates covetousness will prolong his days.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r kơhlôh ngăl pơjuă pơđep. Mă-lei dah đei bu areh kơ sa lơi lơ gô arih sot.

English: A man burdened with bloodshed will flee into a pit; Let no one help him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu tuh pham pơlôch đe, lê̆ sư kơdâu ôn truh tơ lôch; 'nĕ ăn bu tơgŭm sư.

English: Whoever walks blamelessly will be saved, But he who is perverse in his ways will suddenly fall.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei arih sa 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô đei dŏng pơklaih; Bơngai bu kiơ̆ trong đŏng gô huŏng ưh kơ tam băt.

English: He who tills his land will have plenty of bread, But he who follows frivolity will have poverty enough!
Bahnar: Bơngai bu choh mir 'ba gô đei sa rơkah rơkai. Bơngai bu hơlah noh gô hoh răm.

English: A faithful man will abound with blessings, But he who hastens to be rich will not go unpunished.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt gô đei pŭn hiôk lơ; Bơngai bu hăt chă mơdrŏng pă jor gô phak pơmat.

English: To show partiality is not good, Because for a piece of bread a man will transgress.
Bahnar: Mơ̆t dŏng đe noh ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Mă đơ̆ng minh pôm 'bĕng mi ră mă-lei gô pơm glăi.

English: A man with an evil eye hastens after riches, And does not consider that poverty will come upon him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu kret ham, pơnam chă wă kơ mơdrŏng, Gah rŏng ưh kơ băt tơdrong kơ'bah gô truh kơ sư.

English: He who rebukes a man will find more favor afterward Than he who flatters with the tongue.
Bahnar: Bơngai chrih kơ đe, Đơ̆ng rŏng đei đe bơnê. Hloh kơ bơngai yua hơpiĕt pơma pơhlom.

English: Whoever robs his father or his mother, And says, “It is no transgression,” The same is companion to a destroyer.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu tơtông đơ̆ng mĕ 'bă sư, păng khan: “Ưh kơ pơm yoch ôh,” Bơngai noh buăl juăt lu đe wă chă pơrăm.

English: He who is of a proud heart stirs up strife, But he who trusts in the LORD will be prospered.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei jơhngơ̆m ham chă sơlam pơdrŭt đe tơhil băl. Mă-lei bơngai bu băt gơnang kơ Kră Yang gô phĭ jơnap.

English: He who trusts in his own heart is a fool, But whoever walks wisely will be delivered.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gơnang kơ akâu kơdih gô jing bơlŭk. Mă-lei đei bu yak kiơ̆ trong gơh hơgei gô đei hiôk hơđơ̆ng.

English: He who gives to the poor will not lack, But he who hides his eyes will have many curses.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu asong ăn kơ bơngai dơnuh hin ưh kơ kơ'bah ôh. Mă-lei bơngai bu ưh kơ băt mơnat gô đei đe blei hiap.

English: When the wicked arise, men hide themselves; But when they perish, the righteous increase.
Bahnar: Layơ tơdah lu bơngai kơnê̆ iung pơgơ̆r, đe kơdâu ôn đĭ, Mă-lei dah lu sư lôch, lu bơngai tơpăt jing rai lơ.

English: He who is often rebuked, and hardens his neck, Will suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei chrih ling-lang, Mă-lei oei arăng kơ̆l, Gô đei tơdrong truh blư bla na ưh pă kơ đei gơh dŏng pơklaih.
